1.1:
How blessed is the man
    who does not walk in the advice of the wicked,
    who does not stand on the path with sinners,
    and who does not sit in a meeting with mockers.
1.2:
But his delight is in the teaching of the Lord,
and on his teaching he meditates day and night.
1.3:
He is like a tree planted beside streams of water,
    which yields its fruit in season,
    and its leaves do not wither.
Everything he does prospers.
1.4:
Not so the wicked!
No, they are like the chaff which the wind blows away.
1.5:
Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgment,
nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous.
1.6:
Yes, the Lord approves of the way of the righteous,
but the way of the wicked will perish.

2.1:
Why do the nations rage?
Why do the peoples grumble in vain?
2.2:
The kings of the earth take a stand,
and the rulers join together
    against the Lord
    and against his Anointed One.
2.3:
“Let us tear off their chains
and throw off their ropes from us.”
2.4:
The one who is seated in heaven laughs.
The Lord scoffs at them.
2.5:
Then he speaks to them in his anger,
and in his wrath he terrifies them.
2.6: “I have installed my King on Zion, my holy mountain.”
2.7:
I will proclaim the decree of the Lord.
He said to me:
“You are my Son.
Today I have begotten you.
2.8:
Ask me,
and I will give you the nations as your inheritance
and the ends of the earth as your possession.
2.9:
You will smash them with an iron rod.
You will break them to pieces like pottery.”
2.10:
So now, you kings, do what is wise.
Accept discipline, you judges of the earth.
2.11:
Serve the Lord with fear,
and rejoice with trembling.
2.12:
Kiss the Son,
or he will be angry,
and you will be destroyed in your way,
for his wrath can flare up in a moment.
How blessed are all who take refuge in him.

3.1: A psalm by David. When he fled from Absalom, his son.
3.2:
O Lord, how my foes are multiplying!
Many are rising up against me!
3.3:
Many are saying about my life, Interlude
“There is no salvation for him in God.”
3.4:
But you, O Lord, are a shield for me.
You are my glory and the one who lifts up my head.
3.5:
With a loud voice I cry out to the Lord, Interlude
and he answers me from his holy mountain.
3.6:
I lie down, and I sleep.
I awake, because the Lord sustains me.
3.7:
I will not be afraid of the thousands of people
    who line up against me on all sides.
3.8:
Rise up, O Lord! Save me, my God!
Yes, you will strike all my enemies on the jaw.
The teeth of the wicked you will break.
3.9:
Salvation belongs to the Lord. Interlude
Your blessing rests on your people.

4.1: For the choir director. With stringed instruments. A psalm by David.
4.2:
My righteous God, answer me when I call.
When I was under pressure, you gave me relief.
Be merciful to me and hear my prayer.
4.3:
You people, how long will you turn my glory into shame?
How long will you love empty delusions? Interlude
How long will you pursue lies?
4.4:
Know this: The Lord has set apart
    his favored one for himself.
The Lord will hear when I call to him.
4.5:
You may be upset, but do not sin.
When you are on your beds,
    speak to your heart, but remain silent. Interlude
4.6:
Offer righteous sacrifices,
and trust in the Lord.
4.7:
Many are saying, “Who can show us any good?”
Shine the light of your face on us, O Lord.
4.8:
You have placed joy in my heart greater than the joy
    when grain and new wine are plentiful.
4.9:
In complete peace I will lie down, and I will sleep,
for you alone, O Lord, make me dwell in safety.

5.1: For the choir director. For flutes. A psalm by David.
5.2:
Turn your ear to my words, O Lord.
Understand me when I sigh.
5.3:
Pay attention to my cry for help,
    my King and my God,
    for to you I pray.
5.4:
Lord, in the morning you hear my voice.
In the morning I lay out my requests in front of you,
and I watch for your answer.
5.5:
For you are not a God who takes pleasure in evil.
With you the wicked cannot dwell.
5.6:
The arrogant cannot stand before your eyes.
You hate all evildoers.
5.7:
You put to death those who speak lies.
The Lord is disgusted with bloodthirsty, deceitful men.
5.8:
But as for me, by your great mercy
    I will enter your house.
    I will bow down toward your holy temple
        with reverence for you.
5.9:
Lord, lead me in your righteousness.
Because of those who slander me,
make your way straight before me.
5.10:
Nothing reliable comes out of their mouth.
From within them comes destruction.
Their throat is an open grave.
With their tongue they flatter.
5.11:
Declare them guilty, O God!
Let them fall because of their own schemes.
For their many treacherous deeds banish them,
    because they have rebelled against you.
5.12:
But let all who take refuge in you be glad.
Let them sing for joy forever.
You cover them with protection,
    so those who love your name rejoice in you.
5.13:
Yes, you bless the righteous, Lord.
You surround them with your favor as a shield.

6.1:
For the choir director. With stringed instruments.
According to sheminith. A psalm by David.
6.2:
Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger.
Do not discipline me in your wrath.
6.3:
Be merciful to me, Lord, for I am fading away.
Heal me, Lord, for my bones are trembling,
6.4:
and my soul is terrified.
But you, O Lord—how long?
6.5:
Turn, O Lord, and deliver my soul.
Save me because of your mercy.
6.6:
For in death no one remembers you.
In the grave who praises you?
6.7:
I am worn out from my groaning.
I flood my bed all night long.
With my tears I drench my couch.
6.8:
My eyes are blurred by sorrow.
They are worn out because of all my foes.
6.9:
Turn away from me, all you evildoers,
because the Lord has heard the sound of my weeping.
6.10:
The Lord has heard my cry for mercy.
The Lord accepts my prayer.
6.11:
They will be put to shame.
All my enemies will be terrified.
They will turn back.
They will be put to shame in an instant.

7.1:
A shiggaion by David, which he sang to the Lord
because of the words of Cush, from the tribe of Benjamin.
7.2:
O Lord my God, in you I take refuge.
Save me from all my pursuers and deliver me.
7.3:
Otherwise, like a lion they will tear me apart.
They will drag me away with no one to rescue me.
7.4:
O Lord my God, if I have done this,
if there is injustice in my hands,
7.5:
if I have done evil to anyone who is at peace with me,
or if I have robbed my foe for no reason,
7.6:
then let an enemy pursue my life and overtake me.
Let him trample my life to the ground
and make my glory dwell in the dust. Interlude
7.7:
Stand up, O Lord, in your anger.
Rise up against the fury of my foes.
Awake for me. You have commanded justice.
7.8:
A crowd of peoples surrounds you.
Turn against them from on high.
7.9:
Let the Lord judge the peoples.
Acquit me, O Lord, according to my righteousness,
according to my integrity which is in me.
7.10:
The evil of the wicked will come to an end,
but you will establish the righteous.
You search minds and hearts, O righteous God.
7.11: My shield is God, who saves the upright in heart.
7.12:
God, the judge, is righteous,
but he is a God who expresses his wrath every day.
7.13:
If he does not relent,
    the Lord will sharpen his sword.
    He has bent his bow and will string it.
7.14:
He prepares his deadly weapons.
    He will make his arrows flames.
7.15:
Yes, whoever conceives evil and is pregnant with trouble
    will give birth to disappointment.
7.16:
He digs a pit and scoops it out,
and he will fall into the hole he has made.
7.17:
The trouble he causes comes back on his own head.
His violence comes down on top of his own skull.
7.18:
I will thank the Lord because of his righteousness,
and I will make music to the name of the Lord Most High.

8.1: For the choir director. According to gittith. A psalm by David.
8.2:
O Lord, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth!
Set this glory of yours above the heavens.
8.3:
From the lips of little children and nursing babies
    you have established strength because of your foes,
        to put a stop to the enemy and the avenger.
8.4:
Whenever I look up at your heavens, the works of your fingers,
the moon and the stars, which you have set in place—
8.5:
what is man that you remember him,
the son of man that you pay attention to him!
8.6:
Nevertheless, you make him suffer need,
    apart from God for a while,
but you crown him with glory and honor.
8.7:
You make him the ruler over the works of your hands.
You put everything under his feet:
8.8: all flocks and cattle, and even the wild animals,
8.9:
the birds of the sky, and the fish of the sea,
    which pass through the currents of the seas.
8.10: O Lord, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth!

9.1: For the choir director. According to “The Death of the Son.” A psalm by David.
9.2:
I will thank you, Lord, with all my heart.
I will tell about all your wonderful deeds.
9.3:
I will be glad and rejoice in you.
I will make music to your name, O Most High.
9.4:
When my enemies turn back,
they stumble and perish from your presence,
9.5:
for you have upheld my rights and my cause.
You sat on the throne, judging righteously.
9.6:
You have rebuked the nations,
and you made the wicked perish.
You have blotted out their name forever and ever.
9.7:
As for the enemy, their destruction is complete and final.
You have uprooted cities.
Memory of them has perished with them.
9.8:
The Lord is seated forever.
He has established his throne for judgment.
9.9:
The Lord himself will judge the world in righteousness.
He will judge the peoples with fairness.
9.10:
The Lord will be a refuge for those who have been crushed,
a refuge for times of trouble.
9.11:
Those who know your name will trust in you,
for you, O Lord, have not forsaken those who seek you.
9.12:
Make music for the Lord, who is seated in Zion.
Proclaim his deeds among the peoples.
9.13:
Yes, he who avenges bloodshed remembers them.
He does not forget the cry of the afflicted.
9.14:
Have mercy on me, O Lord.
See my afflictions that are caused by those who hate me,
and raise me up from the gates of death,
9.15:
so that I may declare all your praise.
In the gates of the Daughter of Zion I will rejoice in your salvation.
9.16:
The nations have sunk into the pit they have made.
Their feet are caught in the net that they have hidden.
9.17:
The Lord makes himself known by the judgment he has carried out.
By the work of his hands the wicked are snared. Interlude for meditation
9.18:
The wicked return to the grave,
all the nations who forget God.
9.19:
But he will never forget the needy.
The hope of the afflicted will never perish.
9.20:
Rise up, O Lord. Do not let man triumph.
Let the nations be judged in your presence.
9.21:
Strike them with fear, O Lord.
Let the nations know they are only human. Interlude

10.1:
Why, Lord, do you stand so far away?
Why do you hide in times of distress?
10.2:
Because of the pride of the wicked, the oppressed burn.
They are caught in the schemes that the wicked plan.
10.3:
Yes, the wicked man boasts about his heart’s desires.
He blesses the robber. He despises the Lord.
10.4:
With his nose in the air, the wicked does not seek God.
There is no room at all for God in his thoughts.
10.5:
His ways are prosperous all the time.
He is haughty. Your judgments do not concern him.
He snorts at all of his foes.
10.6:
He says in his heart, “I will not be shaken.
Through age after age I will have no trouble.”
10.7:
Cursing fills his mouth, along with lies and threats.
Trouble and evil lie under his tongue.
10.8:
He waits in ambush by the villages.
In hidden places he murders the innocent.
His eyes are spying on the helpless.
10.9:
He lies in ambush. He hides like a lion in a thicket.
He lies in ambush to catch the oppressed.
He catches the oppressed by dragging them in his net.
10.10:
The helpless are crushed. They sink down.
They fall under his strength.
10.11:
He says in his heart, “God has forgotten.
He hides his face. He never sees.”
10.12:
Rise up, O Lord! Lift up your hand, O God.
Do not forget the oppressed.
10.13:
Why does the wicked man despise God?
Why does he say in his heart,
“You do not seek justice”?
10.14:
But you do see. You notice trouble and grief.
You take it into your own hands.
The helpless one abandons himself to you.
For the fatherless you are indeed a helper.
10.15:
Break the arm of the wicked.
You pursue the wickedness of the evil man
    until you find no more.
10.16:
The Lord is King forever and ever.
The nations will perish from his land.
10.17:
Lord, you hear the desire of the afflicted.
You strengthen their hearts,
and your ear pays attention,
10.18:
to obtain justice for the fatherless and the crushed,
so that the worldly man may no longer terrify.

11.1: For the choir director. By David.
11.2:
In the Lord I take refuge.
How can you say to my soul:
“Flee to your mountain like a bird.
11.3:
Look! The wicked bend their bow.
They set their arrow against the string
    to shoot in the darkness at the upright in heart.
11.4:
When the foundations are being torn down,
    what can the righteous do?”
11.5:
The Lord is in his holy temple.
The Lord is on his throne in heaven.
His eyes observe.
He focuses on the children of Adam.
11.6:
The Lord is righteous.
He examines the wicked.
He really hates those who love violence.
11.7:
On the wicked he will rain down fiery coals and sulfur.
A scorching wind will be the cup given to them.
11.8:
Indeed, the Lord is righteous. He loves righteousness.
The upright will view his face.

12.1: For the choir director. According to sheminith. A psalm by David.
12.2:
Save us, Lord, for the merciful have disappeared.
The faithful have vanished from among mankind.
12.3:
Everyone speaks falsehood to his neighbor.
Their flattering lips speak double-talk.
12.4:
May the Lord cut off all flattering lips.
May he cut off every tongue that speaks boastfully,
12.5:
which says, “With our tongues we will establish our power.
We say what we please. Who is lord over us?”
12.6:
“Because of the destruction of the oppressed,
because of the groaning of the poor,
now I will rise up,” says the Lord.
“I will keep him safe from the one who puffs against him.”
12.7:
The words of the Lord are pure words,
like silver refined in a furnace on the ground, purified seven times.
12.8:
You, Lord, will keep them safe.
You will protect them from such people forever.
12.9:
The wicked strut around
    when depravity is honored by the children of Adam.

13.1: For the choir director. A psalm by David.
13.2:
How long, O Lord? Will you forget me forever?
How long will you hide your face from me?
13.3:
How long must I experience worries in my soul,
sorrow in my heart every day?
How long will my enemy tower over me?
13.4:
Look at me. Answer me, O Lord my God.
Give light to my eyes
    so I do not sleep in death,
13.5:
so my enemy does not say, “I have overcome him,”
    so my foes do not rejoice when I fall.
13.6:
But I trust in your mercy.
My heart rejoices in your salvation.
13.7:
I will sing to the Lord
    because he has accomplished his purpose for me.

14.1: For the choir director. By David.
14.2:
The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.”
They are corrupt. They do disgusting things.
There is no one who does good.
14.3:
The Lord looks down from heaven on all the children of Adam
    to see if there is anyone who understands, anyone who seeks God.
14.4:
Every one of them has turned away.
Altogether they have become rotten.
There is no one who does good.
There is not even one.
14.5:
Don’t any of these evildoers understand,
those who devour my people as if they were eating bread?
They do not call on the Lord.
14.6:
There they are! They are terrified
    because God is present in the circle of the righteous.
14.7:
You try to put the plans of the poor to shame,
but the Lord is their refuge.
14.8:
Who will provide salvation for Israel from Zion?
When the Lord restores his people,
let Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad!

15.2:
Lord, who may be a guest in your tent?
Who may dwell on your holy mountain?
15.3:
One who walks with integrity,
who does what is righteous,
and who speaks the truth in his heart.
15.4:
He has no slander on his tongue.
He does not harm his friend,
and he does not defame his neighbor.
15.5:
He despises everyone whom God rejects,
but he honors those who fear the Lord.
When he promises something,
    he does not break his word
    even though it costs him a lot.
15.6:
He does not lend his money to get interest,
and he does not accept a bribe against the innocent.
One who does these things will never be toppled.

16.2: Guard me, O God, for I take refuge in you.
16.3:
I say to the Lord, “You are my Lord.
I have no good apart from you.”
16.4:
The holy ones who are in the land are glorious.
All my delight is in them.
16.5:
Those who chase after another god will increase their sorrows.
I will not pour out their drink offerings of blood.
I will not take up their names on my lips.
16.6:
Lord, you are the cup that has been given to me.
You have secured an allotment for me.
16.7:
The property lines chosen for me fall in pleasant places.
Yes, a delightful inheritance is mine.
16.8:
I will bless the Lord, who guides me.
Even at night my heart instructs me.
16.9:
I have set the Lord always before me.
Because he is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.
16.10:
Therefore my heart is glad,
and my whole being rejoices.
Even my flesh will dwell securely
16.11:
because you will not abandon my life to the grave.
    You will not let your favored one see decay.
16.12:
You have made known to me the path of life,
    fullness of joy in your presence,
    pleasures at your right hand forever.

17.1:
Hear my righteous plea, O Lord.
Pay attention to my outcry.
Turn your ear to my prayer, which is not offered by deceitful lips.
17.2:
May a just verdict for me come from you.
May your eyes observe the things that are right.
17.3:
You have tested my heart.
You have visited me at night.
You have refined me;
you have found nothing wrong.
I resolved that my mouth will not overstep its bounds.
17.4:
As for the deeds of people:
    by the words from your lips
    I have kept myself from the ways of the violent.
17.5:
Keep my footsteps on your paths.
My steps have not slipped.
17.6:
Indeed, I call to you because you will answer me, O God.
Turn your ear toward me. Hear what I say.
17.7:
Perform wonders through your mercy.
By your right hand save those who seek refuge
    from those who rise up against them.
17.8:
Guard me like the pupil of your eye.
In the shadow of your wings hide me
17.9:
from the wicked who try to destroy me,
    from those enemies of my life who surround me.
17.10:
Their hearts are calloused.
Their mouths speak arrogantly.
17.11:
Now they surround our steps.
They watch us to throw us to the ground.
17.12:
He is like a lion that is eager to tear,
like a young lion crouching in its hiding place.
17.13:
Rise, O Lord. Confront him. Bring him down.
Save my life from the wicked by your sword.
17.14:
Save me from such men by your hand, O Lord,
from men of this world, whose reward is in this life.
17.15:
b But you fill the stomachs of those whom you treasure.
Their children are satisfied,
and they leave their wealth to their children.
17.16:
Indeed, in righteousness I will view your face.
When I awake, I will be satisfied with seeing your likeness.

18.1:
For the choir director.
By David, the servant of the Lord, who spoke the words of this song to the Lord on the day when the Lord had delivered him from the grasp of all his enemies, even from the grasp of Saul.
18.2:
Then he said:
I love you, O Lord, my strength.
18.3:
The Lord is my rocky cliff, my stronghold, and my deliverer.
My God is my rock. I take refuge in him.
He is my shield and the horn of my salvation, my high fortress.
18.4:
I call to the Lord, who is worthy of praise,
and I am saved from my enemies.
18.5:
The ropes of death entangled me.
Floodwaters of destruction rolled over me.
18.6:
The ropes of the grave wrapped around me.
The traps of death threatened me.
18.7:
In my distress I called to the Lord.
To my God I cried out.
He heard my voice from his temple.
My cry came before him. It reached his ears.
18.8:
Then the earth shook and quaked,
and the foundations of the mountains trembled.
They shook because the Lord was angry.
18.9:
Smoke rose from his nostrils,
and fire from his mouth devoured.
Coals were set on fire by it.
18.10:
Then he tore open the heavens and came down.
A dark cloud was under his feet.
18.11:
He rode upon a cherub, and he flew.
He soared on the wings of the wind.
18.12:
He made the darkness around him his hiding place.
Dark rain clouds surrounded him like a canopy.
18.13:
Emerging from the brightness in front of him
    his clouds passed by with hail and coals of fire.
18.14:
Then the Lord thundered in the heavens.
The Most High raised his voice with hail and coals of fire.
18.15:
Then he shot his arrows and scattered the enemy.
He shot great lightning bolts and routed them.
18.16:
Then the sources of water were revealed,
and the foundations of the world were uncovered
    by your rebuke, O Lord,
    by the breath of wind from your nostrils.
18.17:
He reached down from on high and took hold of me.
He drew me out of deep waters.
18.18:
Because they were too strong for me,
he rescued me from my powerful enemy,
from those who hate me.
18.19:
They confronted me on the day of my disaster,
but the Lord supported me.
18.20:
Then he brought me out into a wide-open space.
He rescued me because he delighted in me.
18.21:
The Lord has dealt with me according to my righteousness.
According to the cleanness of my hands he has repaid me,
18.22:
for I have kept the ways of the Lord.
I have not done evil and departed from my God.
18.23:
So all his just decrees remain before me,
and I have not turned his statutes away from me.
18.24:
I have been blameless with him.
I have kept myself from guilt.
18.25:
The Lord has repaid me according to my righteousness,
according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.
18.26:
To the merciful you reveal yourself as merciful.
To the blameless person you reveal yourself as blameless.
18.27:
To the pure you reveal yourself as pure,
but to the crooked you reveal yourself as crafty.
18.28:
For you save humble people,
but you bring low the eyes of the arrogant.
18.29:
Yes, you light my lamp, O Lord.
My God turns my darkness to light.
18.30:
For with you I can charge against a battalion,
and with my God I can jump over a wall.
18.31:
This God—his way is blameless.
The speech of the Lord is pure.
He is a shield for all who take refuge in him.
18.32:
For who is God besides the Lord?
And who is the Rock except our God?
18.33:
This God wraps me with strength
and makes my way perfect.
18.34:
By making my feet like those of a deer
    he enables me to stand on high places.
18.35:
Because he trains my hands for battle,
    my arms can draw a bronze bow.
18.36:
Then you give me the shield of your salvation.
Your right hand sustains me,
and you stoop down to lift me up.
18.37:
You widen the path under my feet,
so that my ankles do not give way.
18.38:
I pursued my enemies, and I overtook them.
So I did not turn back until they were wiped out.
18.39:
I crushed them so that they could not rise again.
They fell beneath my feet.
18.40:
You wrapped me with strength for battle.
You made those who rose up against me bow down to me.
18.41:
You made my enemies turn their backs and flee.
I destroyed those who hate me.
18.42:
They cried for help, but there was no one to save them.
They cried to the Lord, but he did not answer them.
18.43:
So I grind them as fine as dust blown by the wind.
I dump them out like mud in the streets.
18.44:
You delivered me from the accusations of the people.
You made me the head of nations.
A people I did not know serve me.
18.45:
As soon as they hear me, they obey me.
Foreigners cower before me.
18.46:
Foreigners fall exhausted.
They come trembling from their strongholds.
18.47:
The Lord lives! Blessed be my Rock!
May the God who saves me be exalted!
18.48: The God who avenges me subdues peoples under me.
18.49:
You delivered me from my enemies.
Yes, you exalted me above those who rose against me.
You rescued me from the violent man.
18.50:
Therefore I will praise you among the nations, Lord.
To your name I will make music.
18.51:
By providing great salvation for his King,
he shows mercy to his Anointed One,
to David and to his Descendant forever.

19.1: For the choir director. A psalm by David.
19.2:
The heavens tell about the glory of God.
The expanse of the sky proclaims the work of his hands.
19.3:
Day after day they pour out speech.
Night after night they display knowledge.
19.4:
They do not speak. They say no words.
Their voice is not heard.
19.5:
Their voice goes out into all the earth,
and their word reaches the end of the world.
God has pitched a tent for the sun in the heavens.
19.6:
It comes out like a bridegroom from his wedding canopy.
It celebrates like a champion who has run his race.
19.7:
It sets out from one end of the heavens.
It runs until it reaches the other end.
There is nowhere to hide from its heat.
19.8:
The law of the Lord is perfect.
It revives the soul.
The testimony of the Lord is trustworthy.
It gives wisdom to the inexperienced.
19.9:
The precepts of the Lord are right.
They give joy to the heart.
The commandment of the Lord is bright.
It gives light to the eyes.
19.10:
The fear of the Lord is pure.
It stands forever.
The just decrees of the Lord are truth.
They are altogether righteous.
19.11:
They are more desirable than gold,
even better than much pure gold.
They are sweeter than honey,
even honey dripping from the honeycomb.
19.12:
Yes, by them your servant is warned.
In keeping them there is great reward.
19.13:
Who can recognize his own errors?
Declare me innocent of hidden sins.
19.14:
Restrain your servant also from deliberate sins.
Do not let them rule over me.
Then I will be blameless.
Then I will be innocent of great rebellion.
19.15:
May the speech from my mouth
and the thoughts in my heart be pleasing to you,
O Lord, my Rock and my Redeemer.

20.1:
May the Lord answer you in the day of distress.
May the name of the God of Jacob lift you up.
20.2:
May he send you help from the holy place.
May he support you from Zion.
20.3:
May he remember all your sacrificial gifts. Interlude
May he accept your burnt offerings.
20.4:
May he give you whatever your heart desires.
May he fulfill all your plans.
20.5:
We will shout joyfully when God saves you.
In the name of our God we will lift up our banners.
May the Lord fulfill all your prayers.
20.6:
Now I know that the Lord saves his Anointed.
He answers him from his holy heavens
    with powerful acts of salvation from his right hand.
20.7:
Some rely on chariots, and some on horses,
but we rely on the name of the Lord our God.
20.8:
They are brought to their knees and fall,
but we rise up and stand firm.
20.9: Lord, save the king! Answer us in the day we call!

21.1:
O Lord, the king rejoices in your strength.
He joyfully celebrates salvation from you.
21.2:
You have granted him what his heart desired. Interlude
You have not denied the request from his lips.
21.3:
Yes, you meet him to give him great blessings.
You place a crown of pure gold on his head.
21.4:
He asked you for life, and you gave it to him—
length of days, forever and ever.
21.5:
He receives great glory through the salvation you gave.
You bestow splendor and majesty on him.
21.6:
Surely you grant him blessings forever.
You make him glad with joy in your presence.
21.7:
Surely the king trusts in the Lord,
and through the mercy of the Most High he will not be shaken.
21.8:
Your hand will reach all your enemies.
Your right hand will reach those who hate you.
21.9:
At the time when you appear, O Lord,
you will make them like a blazing furnace.
In his anger he will swallow them.
Fire will consume them.
21.10:
You will cause their fruit to perish from the earth,
their seed from among the children of Adam.
21.11:
Indeed, they intend evil against you.
They plan wicked schemes,
but they will not succeed,
21.12:
because you will make them turn and run
    when you get ready to aim your arrows at them.
21.13:
Rise up, O Lord, in your strength.
We will sing and make music because of your might.

22.1:
For the choir director. According to “Doe of the Dawn.”
A psalm by David.
22.2:
My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?
My groaning does nothing to save me.
22.3:
My God, I call out by day, but you do not answer.
I call out by night, but there is no relief for me.
22.4: Yet you are seated as the Holy One, praised by Israel.
22.5:
In you our fathers trusted.
They trusted and you delivered them.
22.6:
They cried out to you, and they were rescued.
They trusted in you, and they were not disappointed.
22.7:
But I am a worm and not a man,
scorned by men and despised by the people.
22.8:
All who see me mock me. They sneer.
They shake their heads.
22.9:
They say, “Trust in the Lord.”
“Let the Lord deliver him.
Let him rescue him, if he delights in him.”
22.10:
But you are the one who brought me out of the belly.
You made me trust when I was at my mother’s breasts.
22.11:
I was cast on you from the womb.
From the belly of my mother you have been my God.
22.12:
Do not be distant from me, for distress is near,
and there is no one to help.
22.13:
Many bulls surround me.
Strong bulls from Bashan encircle me.
22.14:
Enemies open their mouths wide against me,
like a lion that tears its prey and roars.
22.15:
Like water I am poured out.
All my bones are pulled apart.
My heart has become like wax.
It has melted in the middle of my chest.
22.16:
My strength is dried up like broken pottery,
and my tongue is stuck to the roof of my mouth.
You lay me in the dust of death.
22.17:
For dogs have surrounded me.
A band of evil men has encircled me.
They have pierced my hands and my feet.
22.18:
I can count all my bones.
They stare and gloat over me.
22.19:
They divide my garments among them.
For my clothing they cast lots.
22.20:
But you, O Lord, do not be distant.
O my Strength, come quickly to help me.
22.21:
Deliver my life from the sword,
my only life from the power of the dog.
22.22:
Save me from the mouth of the lion.
From the horns of the wild oxen you have answered me.
22.23:
I will declare your name to my brothers.
In the midst of the congregation I will praise you.
22.24:
You who fear the Lord, praise him!
All you descendants of Jacob, honor him!
Stand in awe of him, all you descendants of Israel!
22.25:
For he has not despised nor detested the affliction of the afflicted.
He has not hidden his face from him,
but when he cried out to him, he heard.
22.26:
You are the source of my praise in the great congregation.
I will fulfill my vows in the presence of those who fear him.
22.27:
The poor will eat and be satisfied.
Those who seek him will praise the Lord—
may he live in your hearts forever!
22.28:
All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the Lord,
and all the families of the nations will bow down before you.
22.29:
For the kingdom belongs to the Lord,
and he rules over the nations.
22.30:
All the rich of the earth will eat and bow down.
All who go down to the dust will kneel before him—
those who cannot keep themselves alive.
22.31:
Descendants will serve him.
For generations people will be told about the Lord.
22.32:
They will come and proclaim his righteousness
    to a people yet to be born—
because he has done it.

23.1:
The Lord is my shepherd.
I lack nothing.
23.2:
He causes me to lie down in green pastures.
He leads me beside quiet waters.
23.3:
He restores my soul.
He guides me in paths of righteousness for his name’s sake.
23.4:
Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,
I will fear no evil, for you are with me.
Your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
23.5:
You set a table for me in the presence of my foes.
You drench my head with oil.
My cup is overflowing.
23.6:
Surely goodness and mercy will pursue me all the days of my life,
and I will live in the house of the Lord forever.

24.1:
The earth is the Lord’s
and everything that fills it,
the world and all who live in it,
24.2:
because he founded it on the seas,
and he established it on the rivers.
24.3:
Who may go up to the mountain of the Lord?
Who may stand in his holy place?
24.4:
He who has clean hands and a pure heart,
whose soul is not set on what is false,
who does not swear deceitfully.
24.5:
He will receive blessing from the Lord
and righteousness from the God who saves him.
24.6:
Such are the people of Jacob who look for the Lord,
who seek your face. Interlude
24.7:
Lift up your heads, you gates.
Lift yourselves up, you ancient doors,
and the King of Glory will come in.
24.8:
Who is this King of Glory?
The Lord strong and mighty,
the Lord mighty in battle.
24.9:
Lift up your heads, you gates.
Lift up, you ancient doors,
and the King of Glory will come in.
24.10:
Who is he, this King of Glory?
The Lord of Armies—he is the King of Glory. Interlude

25.1: To you, O Lord, I will lift up my soul.
25.2:
In you I have trusted, O my God.
Do not let me be put to shame.
Do not let my enemies triumph over me.
25.3:
All who hope in you will never be put to shame,
but those who are treacherous for no reason will be put to shame.
25.4:
Make known to me your ways, O Lord.
Teach me your paths.
25.5:
Make me walk in your truth and teach me,
because you are the God who saves me.
In you I hope all day long.
25.6:
Remember, O Lord, your compassion and your mercy,
for they are from eternity.
25.7:
Do not remember the sins of my youth and my rebellious ways.
According to your mercy remember me,
because of your goodness, O Lord.
25.8:
Good and upright is the Lord.
Therefore, he instructs sinners in the right way.
25.9:
He directs the humble to what is just,
and he teaches the humble his way.
25.10:
All the ways of the Lord are mercy and truth
    for those who keep his covenant and his testimonies.
25.11:
For the sake of your name, O Lord,
you forgive my guilt, although it is great.
25.12:
Who, then, is the man who fears the Lord?
The Lord will instruct him in the way he chooses.
25.13:
That man will enjoy a good life,
and his descendants will possess the land.
25.14:
The guidance of the Lord is with those who fear him.
His covenant will give them knowledge.
25.15:
My eyes are always on the Lord,
because he frees my feet from the net.
25.16:
Turn toward me and be gracious to me,
because I am lonely and afflicted.
25.17:
The distress of my heart increases.
Bring me out of my anguish.
25.18:
See my affliction and my trouble,
and take away all my sins.
25.19:
See my enemies—
how they have increased,
and how violently they hate me!
25.20:
Guard my life and rescue me.
Do not let me be put to shame,
for I have taken refuge in you.
25.21:
May integrity and uprightness protect me,
    because I wait for you.
25.22: Redeem Israel, O God, from all its distress!

26.1:
Judge me favorably, O Lord,
because I have walked in my integrity.
In the Lord I have trusted. I have not wavered.
26.2:
Test me, O Lord, and examine me.
Refine my thoughts and my emotions,
26.3:
for your mercy is in front of my eyes,
and I keep walking in your truth.
26.4:
I do not sit with deceivers.
I do not associate with hypocrites.
26.5:
I hate the company of evildoers.
I do not sit with the wicked.
26.6:
I wash my hands from sin,
so I can march around your altar, O Lord,
26.7:
to shout thanks to you
    and to proclaim all your wonderful deeds.
26.8:
Lord, I love the house where you reside,
the place where your glory dwells.
26.9:
Do not snatch my soul away along with sinners,
nor my life with bloodthirsty men,
26.10:
who grasp wicked schemes in their hands,
whose right hands are full of bribes.
26.11:
But as for me, I will walk in my integrity.
Redeem me and be merciful to me.
26.12:
My feet stand on level ground.
In the assemblies I will bless the Lord.

27.1:
The Lord is my light and my salvation—
whom shall I fear?
The Lord is the stronghold of my life—
of whom shall I be afraid?
27.2:
When evildoers advance against me to eat my flesh,
when my foes and my enemies come against me,
it is they who will stumble and fall.
27.3:
If an army lines up against me, my heart will not fear.
If war rises against me, even then I will keep trusting.
27.4:
One thing I ask from the Lord. This is what I seek:
that I live in the house of the Lord all the days of my life,
    to gaze on the beauty of the Lord,
    and to seek him in his temple.
27.5:
Yes, he will hide me in his shelter on the day of trouble.
He will hide me in his tent.
He will set me high on a rock.
27.6:
Then my head will be lifted up above the enemies who surround me.
I will offer sacrifices at his tent with a joyful shout.
I will sing and make music to the Lord.
27.7:
Hear me, O Lord. With my voice I call.
Be merciful to me and answer me.
27.8:
When you say, “Seek my face,” my heart says to you,
    “Your face, Lord, I will seek.”
27.9:
Do not hide your face from me.
Do not turn your servant away in anger.
You have been my help.
Do not reject me or forsake me, O God who saves me.
27.10:
If my father and my mother abandoned me,
    the Lord would take me in.
27.11:
Lord, teach me your way,
and lead me in a straight path because of my oppressors.
27.12:
Do not give me up to the desire of my foes,
because false witnesses rise up against me,
and so do those who breathe out violence.
27.13:
Unless I was confident to see the goodness of the Lord
    in the land of the living—
27.14:
Wait for the Lord. Be strong and take heart,
and wait for the Lord!

28.1:
O Lord, I keep calling to you.
My Rock, do not be deaf to me.
If you remain silent to me,
I will become like those who go down to the pit.
28.2:
Hear the sound of my plea for mercy when I cry out to you,
when I lift up my hands toward your most holy sanctuary.
28.3:
Do not drag me away with the wicked, with those evildoers.
They speak peace to their neighbors but hide evil in their hearts.
28.4:
Give to them what they have done to others.
According to their evil actions,
according to the deeds of their hands,
punish them.
Repay to them what they deserve.
28.5:
Because they do not recognize the works of the Lord
or the deeds of his hands,
he will tear them down and not build them up.
28.6:
Blessed be the Lord,
because he has heard the sound of my plea for mercy.
28.7:
The Lord is my strength and my shield.
In him my heart trusts, and I am helped.
My heart also celebrates.
With my song I will give thanks to him.
28.8:
The Lord is their strength.
He is a stronghold of salvation for his anointed king.
28.9:
Save your people, and bless the people that belong to you.
Shepherd them, and carry them forever.

29.1:
Ascribe to the Lord, you sons of God,
Ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
29.2:
Ascribe to the Lord the glory of his name.
Bow down to the Lord in the splendor of holiness.
29.3:
The voice of the Lord is heard over the waters.
The God of glory thunders.
The Lord thunders above the mighty waters.
29.4:
The voice of the Lord thunders in power.
The voice of the Lord thunders in majesty.
29.5:
The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars.
The Lord shatters the cedars of Lebanon.
29.6:
He makes Mount Lebanon skip like a calf.
Sirion skips like a young wild ox.
29.7: The voice of the Lord slashes with flashes of fire.
29.8:
The voice of the Lord shakes the wilderness.
The Lord shakes the Wilderness of Kadesh.
29.9:
The voice of the Lord destroys the oaks
and strips the forests bare.
So in his temple they all say, “Glory!”
29.10:
The Lord is seated over the flood.
The Lord is seated as King forever.
29.11:
The Lord gives strength to his people.
The Lord blesses his people with peace.

30.1:
I will exalt you, O Lord,
because you lifted me up.
You did not let my enemies rejoice over me.
30.2:
O Lord my God, I cried out to you,
and you healed me.
30.3:
Lord, you snatched my life from the grave.
You kept me alive so I did not go down into the pit.
30.4:
Make music to the Lord, you his favored ones,
and give thanks when you remember his holiness,
30.5:
for we spend a moment under his anger,
but we enjoy a lifetime in his favor.
In the evening, weeping comes to stay through the night,
but in the morning, there is rejoicing!
30.6:
But I—I said in my security,
“I will never be knocked down.”
30.7:
Lord, in your favor you made strength
    stand like a mountain for me.
Then you hid your face. I was terrified.
30.8:
To you, O Lord, I call.
To the Lord I cry for mercy:
30.9:
“What gain is there in shedding my blood,
in sending me down to destruction?
Will the dust praise you?
Will it proclaim your truth?
30.10:
Lord, hear and be merciful to me.
Lord, be a helper for me.”
30.11:
You turned my mourning into dancing.
You removed my sackcloth and clothed me with joy,
30.12:
so that my whole being may make music to you
and not be silent.
O Lord my God, I thank you forever.

31.1:
In you, Lord, I have taken refuge.
Let me never be put to shame.
In your righteousness deliver me.
31.2:
Turn your ear toward me.
Hurry! Rescue me!
Be a rock where I take refuge,
a fortified place that saves me.
31.3:
Yes, you are my rocky cliff and my stronghold.
For the sake of your name you will lead me and guide me.
31.4:
You will pull me out of the net that they hid for me,
because you are my refuge.
31.5:
Into your hand I commit my spirit.
You have redeemed me, O Lord, the God of truth.
31.6:
I hate those who keep worthless idols,
but I trust in the Lord.
31.7:
I will be glad and rejoice in your mercy,
because you saw my affliction.
You knew the distress of my soul.
31.8:
You have not left me in the hand of the enemy.
You have made my feet stand in a wide-open space.
31.9:
Be merciful to me, Lord, for I am in distress.
My eye grows weak with sorrow—
my soul and my body too.
31.10:
Yes, my life is consumed by grief,
and my years by groaning.
My strength fails because of my guilt,
and my bones grow weak.
31.11:
Because of all my foes,
I am a disgrace, especially to my neighbors.
I am dreaded by those who know me.
Those who see me on the street flee from me.
31.12:
I have been forgotten like a dead man, gone from memory.
I have become like a broken pot.
31.13:
Yes, I hear the slander of many.
There is terror on every side.
When they conspire together against me,
they plot to take my life.
31.14:
But I—I trust in you, O Lord.
I say, “You are my God.”
31.15:
My times are in your hand.
Deliver me from the hand of my enemies
and from those who pursue me.
31.16:
Let your face shine on your servant.
Save me in your mercy.
31.17:
Do not allow me to be put to shame, O Lord,
because I have cried out to you.
But let the wicked be put to shame.
Let them be silent in the grave.
31.18:
Let lying lips be silenced,
those who speak against the righteous
    impudently with pride and contempt.
31.19:
How great is your goodness,
which you store up for those who fear you,
which you deliver for those who take refuge in you
    in the presence of the people.
31.20:
You hide them in your presence from the schemes of man.
You conceal them in your shelter from accusing tongues.
31.21:
Blessed be the Lord,
because he made his mercy wonderful for me
    when I was in a besieged city.
31.22:
In my alarm I said, “I am cut off from before your eyes!”
But you heard the sound of my cry for mercy
    when I cried out to you.
31.23:
Love the Lord, all his favored ones!
The Lord preserves the faithful,
but he pays back in full the one who acts proudly.
31.24:
Be strong, and let your heart be firm,
    all you who wait confidently for the Lord.

32.2:
How blessed is the person
    whose rebellion is forgiven,
    whose sin is covered.
32.3:
How blessed is the person
    whose guilt the Lord does not charge against him,
    in whose spirit there is no deceit.
32.4:
When I kept silent,
my bones wasted away as I groaned all day long.
32.5:
For day and night your hand was heavy on me. Interlude
My moisture was dried up by the droughts of summer.
32.6:
I acknowledged my sin to you,
and I did not cover up my guilt.
I said, “I will confess my rebellion to the Lord,” Interlude
and you forgave the guilt of my sin.
32.7:
Because of this, let everyone who receives favor pray to you
    at a time when you may be found.
Surely when the mighty waters overflow,
they will not reach him.
32.8:
You are my hiding place.
You will protect me from distress. Interlude
You will surround me with shouts of deliverance.
32.9:
I will make you wise.
I will instruct you in the way that you should go.
I will guide you, keeping my eye on you.
32.10:
Do not be like a horse or a mule, which has no understanding.
Its mouth must be controlled by a bit and bridle,
or else it will not come to you.
32.11:
Many are the sorrows of the wicked,
but mercy will surround those who trust in the Lord.
32.12:
Rejoice in the Lord and celebrate, all you righteous,
and shout joyfully, all you upright in heart.

33.1:
Shout joyfully to the Lord, you righteous.
The praise of the upright is beautiful.
33.2:
Thank the Lord with a lyre.
Make music for him with the ten-stringed harp.
33.3:
Sing to him a new song.
Play skillfully and shout praises.
33.4:
Yes, the word of the Lord is right,
and everything he does is trustworthy.
33.5:
He loves righteousness and justice.
The mercy of the Lord fills the earth.
33.6:
By the word of the Lord the heavens were made.
By the breath of his mouth he made the whole army of stars.
33.7:
He gathers the water of the sea into a heap.
He puts the depths into storehouses.
33.8:
Let all the earth fear the Lord.
Let all the inhabitants of the world revere him.
33.9:
For he said, “Let it be,” and it was!
He gave a command, and there it stood.
33.10:
The Lord wrecks the plan of the nations.
He hinders the intentions of the peoples.
33.11:
The plan of the Lord stands forever.
The intentions of his heart stand through all generations.
33.12:
How blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord,
the people he chose to be his possession.
33.13:
From heaven the Lord observes.
He sees all the children of Adam.
33.14: From his throne room he looks at all the inhabitants of earth.
33.15:
He alone is the one who shapes all their hearts.
He understands all their deeds.
33.16:
No king is saved by the great size of his army.
No hero is rescued by his great strength.
33.17:
You cannot rely on a horse to save you.
Its great strength will not deliver you.
33.18:
Look, the eye of the Lord is on those who fear him,
on those who wait for his mercy.
33.19:
He will deliver their souls from death.
He keeps them alive in famine.
33.20:
Our souls wait for the Lord.
He is our help and our shield.
33.21:
Yes, in him our heart rejoices,
because we trust in his holy name.
33.22:
May your mercy, O Lord, be on us,
    even as we wait confidently for you.

34.1: By David. When he pretended to be insane in the presence of Abimelek, who drove him away, and David left.
34.2:
I will bless the Lord at all times.
His praise will always be in my mouth.
34.3:
In the Lord my soul will boast.
The humble will hear and rejoice.
34.4:
Proclaim the greatness of the Lord with me,
and let us exalt his name together.
34.5:
I sought the Lord, and he answered me.
From all my terrors he delivered me.
34.6:
His people look to him and are radiant,
and their faces will never blush.
34.7:
This poor man called, and the Lord heard.
From all his distress the Lord saved him.
34.8:
The Angel of the Lord camps around those who fear him,
and he delivers them.
34.9:
Taste and see that the Lord is good.
Blessed is everyone who takes refuge in him.
34.10:
Fear the Lord, you his saints,
since those who fear him lack nothing.
34.11:
Young lions may lack food and be hungry,
but those who seek the Lord do not lack any good thing.
34.12:
Come, children, listen to me.
I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
34.13:
Who wants to find pleasure in life?
Who would love to experience many good days?
34.14:
Guard your tongue from evil
and your lips from speaking deceit.
34.15:
Turn from evil and do good.
Seek peace and pursue it.
34.16:
The eyes of the Lord watch over the righteous.
His ears listen to their cry.
34.17:
The face of the Lord is set against those who do evil,
    to cut off memory of them from the earth.
34.18:
The righteous cry out, and the Lord hears.
From all their distress he delivers them.
34.19:
The Lord is close to the brokenhearted.
He saves those whose spirits have been crushed.
34.20:
Many are the troubles of the righteous,
but the Lord delivers him from them all.
34.21:
He watches over all his bones;
not one of them will be broken.
34.22:
Evil will slay the wicked.
Those who hate the righteous will be found guilty.
34.23:
The Lord redeems the soul of his servants.
Anyone who takes refuge in him will not be found guilty.

35.1:
Lord, oppose those who oppose me.
Fight against those who fight against me.
35.2:
Put on your armor and shield.
Rise up to help me.
35.3:
Wield a spear and block the way of those who pursue me.
Say to my soul, “I am your salvation.”
35.4:
May those who seek my life be disgraced and put to shame.
May those who plot to harm me be turned back and dismayed.
35.5:
May they be like chaff driven by the wind.
May an angel of the Lord drive them away.
35.6:
May their path be dark and slippery.
May an angel of the Lord pursue them.
35.7:
Without cause they hid their net to catch me.
Without cause they dug a pit to trap me.
35.8:
May devastation overtake him before he knows it.
May the net which he hid catch him.
May he fall into it to his own destruction.
35.9:
Then my soul will rejoice in the Lord.
It will delight in his salvation.
35.10:
All my bones will say, “Lord, who is like you?
You rescue the poor from the one too strong for him,
the poor and needy from the one who robs him.”
35.11:
Malicious witnesses arise.
They ask me about things I do not know.
35.12:
They repay me with evil instead of good.
They rob my soul of happiness.
35.13:
But when they were sick, I dressed in sackcloth.
I afflicted myself with fasting.
My prayers returned unanswered.
35.14:
I walked around mourning,
    as if mourning for a friend or for my brother.
I bowed down, dirty with ashes,
    as though mourning for my mother.
35.15:
But when I stumbled, they were happy.
They gathered together.
Yes, attackers gathered together against me
    though I did not expect it.
They ripped me and were never quiet.
35.16: Like profane mockers, they gnashed their teeth at me.
35.17:
Lord, how long will you look on?
Restore my life from their devastating attacks,
my precious life from these young lions.
35.18:
I will give thanks to you in the great assembly.
In a large crowd I will praise you.
35.19:
Do not let them rejoice over me—
those who are my enemies without cause.
Do not let those who hate me without reason mock me.
35.20:
For they do not speak for peace,
but they devise false accusations
    against those who live quietly in the land.
35.21:
They also open their mouths wide against me.
They say, “Ha! Ha! We see with our own eyes.”
35.22:
Lord, you have seen all this.
Do not be silent.
Lord, do not be far from me.
35.23:
Wake up and rise up to my defense!
My God and Lord, rise to my cause.
35.24:
Judge me according to your righteousness,
    O Lord, my God.
Do not let them rejoice over me.
35.25:
Do not let them say in their hearts,
    “Aha! Just what we wanted!”
Do not let them say,
    “We have swallowed him.”
35.26:
May those who rejoice over my trouble
    be put to shame and disgrace.
May those who exalt themselves over me
    be clothed with shame and contempt.
35.27:
May those who are pleased by my acquittal
    shout for joy and be glad.
May they always say, “The Lord is great.
He takes delight in the peace of his servant.”
35.28:
My tongue will report your righteousness
and your praise all day long.

36.1: For the choir director. By the servant of the Lord. By David.
36.2:
A declaration about the rebellion of the wicked is deep in my heart.
There is no dread of God before his eyes,
36.3:
because he flatters himself in his own eyes
    too much to notice his guilt and to hate it.
36.4:
The words from his mouth are deception and deceit.
He has given up being wise and doing good.
36.5:
He plots deception even on his bed.
He sets out on a path that is not good.
He does not reject wrong.
36.6:
Lord, your mercy reaches to the heavens.
Your faithfulness to the skies.
36.7:
Your righteousness is as high as the mountains of God.
Your justice is as deep as the ocean.
You save both man and animal, O Lord.
36.8:
How precious is your mercy, O God!
So all people find refuge in the shadow of your wings.
36.9:
They are satisfied by the rich food of your house.
You let them drink from your river of delights.
36.10:
For with you is the fountain of life.
In your light we see light.
36.11:
Stretch out your mercy over those who know you,
your righteousness to the upright in heart.
36.12:
Do not let the foot of the proud trample me.
Do not let the hand of the wicked drive me away.
36.13:
There the evildoers have fallen.
They have been thrown down.
They are not able to rise!

37.1:
Do not fret because of evildoers.
Do not be envious of those who do wrong,
37.2:
for like grass they will wither quickly.
Like green plants they will wilt.
37.3:
Trust in the Lord, and do good.
Dwell in the land and feed on faithfulness.
37.4:
Take pleasure in the Lord,
and he will grant your heart’s desires.
37.5:
Commit your way to the Lord.
Trust in him, and he will act.
37.6:
He will make your righteousness shine like light,
your justice like noon.
37.7:
Be silent before the Lord. Wait patiently for him.
Do not fret when an evil man succeeds in his ways,
when he carries out his wicked schemes.
37.8:
Let go of anger and abandon rage.
Do not fret—it leads only to evil.
37.9:
For evildoers will be cut off,
but those who hope in the Lord will inherit the earth.
37.10:
After a little while the wicked will be no more.
When you search for them at their place, they are not there.
37.11:
But the meek will inherit the earth.
They will enjoy plenty of peace.
37.12:
The wicked person plots against the righteous.
He gnashes his teeth at him,
37.13:
but the Lord laughs at the wicked,
because he sees that his day is coming.
37.14:
The wicked draw their sword,
and they bend their bow
    to make the poor and needy fall,
    to slaughter those whose ways are upright.
37.15:
Their swords will pierce their hearts,
and their bows will be broken.
37.16:
Better the little that one righteous person has
    than the wealth of many wicked people,
37.17:
because the arms of the wicked will be broken,
but the Lord upholds the righteous.
37.18:
The Lord knows the days of the blameless.
Their inheritance will last forever.
37.19:
They will not be ashamed in time of disaster.
In days of famine they will be full.
37.20:
Surely the wicked will perish.
The enemies of the Lord will be
    like beautiful flowers in the pastures.
But they will vanish. Like smoke they will vanish.
37.21:
The wicked borrow and do not repay,
but the righteous are gracious and give.
37.22:
So those God blesses will inherit the earth,
but those he curses will be cut off.
37.23:
By the Lord the steps of a person are made secure.
Then he will delight in his way.
37.24:
Though he falls, he will not stay down,
because the Lord holds him by his hand.
37.25:
I was a young man. Now I am old.
But I have never seen a righteous person forsaken
or his children begging for bread.
37.26:
Every day he is gracious and lends.
His children will be blessed.
37.27:
Turn back from evil and do good.
Then you will remain forever.
37.28:
For the Lord loves justice.
He will not forsake his favored ones.
They will be protected forever,
but the descendants of the wicked will be cut off.
37.29:
The righteous will inherit the earth.
They will dwell on it forever.
37.30:
The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom.
His tongue speaks what is just.
37.31:
The law of his God is in his heart.
His steps do not slip.
37.32: The wicked spy on the righteous one and seek to kill him.
37.33:
The Lord will not leave him in their hand.
He will not let him be condemned when he is put on trial.
37.34:
Wait for the Lord and keep to his way.
He will raise you up to take possession of the earth.
When the wicked are cut off, you will see it.
37.35:
I saw a wicked, ruthless man.
He was rooted like a green plant in its native soil,
37.36:
but he passed away. Just like that, he was gone!
I searched for him, but he could not be found.
37.37:
Take note of the blameless. Look at the upright.
Yes, there is a future for the man of peace.
37.38:
But rebels will be completely destroyed.
The future of the wicked will be cut off.
37.39:
The salvation of the righteous comes from the Lord.
He is their stronghold in times of stress.
37.40:
The Lord helps them and delivers them.
He delivers them from the wicked.
He saves them, because they have taken refuge in him.

38.1:
Lord, do not rebuke me in anger.
Do not discipline me in wrath.
38.2:
Indeed, your arrows have stuck in me.
Your hand has come down on me.
38.3:
There is no health in my flesh because of your rage.
There is no wellness in my bones because of my sin,
38.4:
because my guilt has gone over my head.
Like a heavy burden, it is too heavy for me.
38.5: My wounds stink and ooze because of my folly.
38.6:
I am drooping. I am completely bent over.
All day long I go around mourning.
38.7:
Even my back burns with pain.
My whole body is unhealthy.
38.8:
I have become numb. I am totally crushed.
I groan loudly because of my anxious thoughts.
38.9:
Lord, all my needs lie before you.
My sighs are not hidden from you.
38.10:
My heart beats quickly. My strength leaves me.
Even the light of my eyes is gone from me.
38.11:
My loved ones and my friends stand far away
    because of the blow I have suffered.
My neighbors stand at a distance.
38.12:
Those who pursue my life set traps.
Those who seek to harm me talk about my ruin.
All day long they plot deception.
38.13:
I am deaf. I cannot hear.
Like a mute person, I cannot open my mouth.
38.14:
I am like a man who cannot hear.
No response comes from his mouth.
38.15:
Yet I wait for you, Lord.
You will answer, O Lord my God.
38.16:
So I said, “Do not let them celebrate because of me.
Do not let them gloat when my foot slips.”
38.17:
Look! I am about to fall,
and I am always in pain,
38.18:
so I declare my guilt,
and I am troubled by my sin.
38.19:
My aggressive enemies are numerous.
Those who hate me for no reason are many.
38.20:
Those who repay evil for good
    slander me because I pursue what is good.
38.21:
Do not forsake me, O Lord.
My God, do not be far from me.
38.22: Hurry to help me, O Lord, my salvation.

39.1: For the choir director. For Jeduthun. A psalm by David.
39.2:
I said, “I will guard my ways
so that I do not sin with my tongue.
I will keep a muzzle on my mouth
    as long as the wicked are confronting me.”
39.3:
I said nothing. I kept silent.
I did not even say anything good,
but my pain became worse.
39.4:
Inside me my heart grew hot.
As I fretted, the fire burned.
So I spoke with my tongue.
39.5:
Lord, help me understand my end.
What is the limit of my days?
Let me know how fleeting I am.
39.6:
See, you have cut short my days.
My brief time before you is like nothing.
Indeed, every person, even at his best,
    is just a puff of air. Interlude
39.7:
A man flickers like a mirage.
He really has no more effect than a breeze.
He piles things up, never knowing who will get them.
39.8:
But now what do I wait for, Lord?
My hope is in you.
39.9:
Save me from all my rebellious acts.
Do not let fools scorn me.
39.10:
I said nothing.
I did not open my mouth,
because you are the one who caused this.
39.11:
Stop punching me.
By the attack of your hand I am finished.
39.12:
By your rebuke against guilt you discipline a man.
Like a moth you consume what he desires.
Indeed, every person is nothing but a puff of air. Interlude
39.13:
Hear my prayer, O Lord.
Listen to my cry.
Do not ignore my tears,
for with you I am an alien,
just a visitor, as were all my ancestors.
39.14:
Look away from me, so I can smile again
before I depart and am no more.

40.1:
I waited and waited for the Lord.
Then he turned to me and heard my cry.
40.2:
Then he pulled me up from the deadly quicksand,
from the mud and muck.
He made my feet stand on a rock to keep my steps from slipping.
40.3:
Then he put a new song in my mouth,
a hymn of praise to our God.
Many will see and fear.
They will trust in the Lord.
40.4:
How blessed is everyone who trusts in the Lord,
who does not look to the proud
or to those who turn aside to falsehood.
40.5:
Many are the wonders you have done, O Lord my God.
No one can explain to you all your thoughts for us.
If I try to speak and tell about them,
they are too many to count.
40.6:
Sacrifice and offering you did not desire.
Ears you have opened for me.
You did not ask for burnt offerings and sin offerings.
40.7:
Then I said, “Here I am, I have come.
The book written on a scroll tells about me.
40.8:
My God, I take pleasure in doing your will.
Your law is in my heart.”
40.9:
I preach righteousness in the great assembly.
Indeed, I do not hold back my lips, O Lord, as you know.
40.10:
I do not conceal your righteousness deep in my heart.
I speak of your faithfulness and salvation.
I do not hide your mercy and your truth from the great assembly.
40.11:
Lord, you do not hold back your compassion from me.
Let your mercy and your truth always protect me,
40.12:
although troubles without number surround me.
Punishments for my guilt have smothered me, so I cannot see.
They are more than the hairs of my head, so my courage deserts me.
40.13:
Be pleased, O Lord, to save me.
Lord, hurry to help me.
40.14:
Let all who seek to end my life be frustrated and completely confused.
Let everyone who desires my ruin be turned back and disgraced.
40.15:
Let those who say to me, “Aha! We got you!” be dismayed,
because they have been put to shame.
40.16:
But let all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you.
Let those who love your salvation always say,
“The Lord is great!”
40.17:
Yet I am poor and needy.
May the Lord think about me.
You are my help and my deliverer.
O my God, do not delay.

41.1:
How blessed is the person who understands the plight of the weak!
May the Lord deliver him in the day of trouble.
41.2:
May the Lord guard him and keep him alive.
May he be blessed in the land.
May you not surrender him to the desire of his enemies.
41.3:
May the Lord sustain him on his sickbed.
You raise him up from his bed.
41.4:
I said, “Lord, have mercy on me.
Heal my soul, for I have sinned against you.”
41.5:
My enemies speak evil about me:
“When will he die and his name perish?”
41.6:
If one comes to see me, he speaks falsely.
In his heart he collects malicious plans.
He goes out. He speaks about them in the street.
41.7:
All who hate me whisper together against me.
They plan evil for me. They say,
41.8:
“A deadly affliction is poured out on him.
He will never get up from the place where he lies.”
41.9:
Even a man who was at peace with me,
a man whom I trusted, who ate my bread,
    has raised up his heel to step on me.
41.10:
But you, Lord, have mercy on me.
Raise me up, so that I can repay them.
41.11:
From this I know that you are pleased with me:
My enemy does not triumph over me.
41.12:
As for me—in my integrity you uphold me,
and you set me up in your presence forever.
41.13:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from eternity to eternity.
Amen and Amen.

42.1: For the choir director. A maskil by the Sons of Korah.
42.2:
As a doe pants for streams of water,
so my soul pants for you, O God.
42.3:
My soul thirsts for God, for the living God.
When can I go and appear before God?
42.5:
I am overcome by my emotions
whenever I remember these things:
    how I used to arrive with the crowd,
    as I led the procession to the house of God,
    with loud shouts of thanksgiving,
    with the crowd celebrating the festival.
42.6:
Why are you so depressed, O my soul?
Why so disturbed within me?
Hope in God, for I will again praise him
    for salvation from his presence.
42.7:
My God, my soul is depressed within me.
Therefore I will remember you from the land of the Jordan,
from the heights of Hermon, from Mount Mizar.
42.8:
Deep calls to deep in the roar of your rapids.
All your breakers and your waves have swept over me.
42.9:
By day the Lord commands his mercy,
and at night his song is with me—a prayer to the God of my life.
42.10:
I say to God my Rock, “Why have you forgotten me?
Why must I go around mourning because of oppression by the enemy?”
42.11:
It is like breaking my bones when my foes taunt me.
All day long they say to me, “Where is your God?”
42.12:
Why are you so depressed, O my soul?
Why so disturbed within me?
Hope in God, for I will again praise him
    for my salvation from the face of my God.

43.1:
Judge me justly, O God,
and plead my case against an ungodly nation.
Rescue me from the deceitful, wicked man.
43.2:
I know you are God, my stronghold.
Why have you rejected me?
Why must I go around mourning
    because of oppression by the enemy?
43.3:
Send out your light and your truth.
Let them guide me.
Let them bring me to your holy mountain,
to your dwelling.
43.4:
Then I will go to the altar of God,
to God, my joy and gladness.
Then I will praise you with the lyre, O God, my God.
43.5:
Why are you so depressed, O my soul?
Why so disturbed within me?
Hope in God, for I will again praise him
    for my salvation from the face of my God.

44.1:
God, our ears have heard.
Our fathers have told us the work you performed
    in their days, in days long ago.
44.2:
By your hand you drove out the nations,
but you planted your people.
You crushed the peoples,
but you sent your people forward.
44.3:
For it was not by their sword
    that they took possession of the land.
It was not their arm that saved them.
It was your right hand and your arm,
and the light from your face,
because you took pleasure in them.
44.4:
You are the one who is my King, O God.
Command victories for Jacob.
44.5:
Through you we drive back our foes.
Through your name we trample our adversaries.
44.6:
For I do not trust in my bow,
and my sword does not save me.
44.7:
But you save us from our foes,
and you put those who hate us to shame.
44.8:
In God we make our boast all day,
and we will praise your name forever. Interlude
44.9:
But now you have rejected and humbled us,
and you do not go out with our armies.
44.10:
You made us turn back before the foe,
and those who hate us have taken plunder for themselves.
44.11:
You give us up for food like sheep,
and you have scattered us among the nations.
44.12:
You sold your people for no great price,
and you have not profited from their sale.
44.13:
You have made us a reproach to our neighbors,
scorn and ridicule to those around us.
44.14:
You have made us a laughingstock among the nations,
a reason for the peoples to shake their heads.
44.15:
All day my disgrace is right in front of me,
and the shame on my face covers me,
44.16:
because of the voice of the slanderer and reviler,
because of the enemy and avenger.
44.17:
All this came on us, though we had not forgotten you.
We had not been false to your covenant.
44.18:
Our hearts had not turned back.
Our steps had not slipped off your path.
44.19:
But you crushed us and made us a home for jackals,
and you covered us with the shadow of death.
44.20:
If we had forgotten the name of our God
or spread out our hands to a foreign god,
44.21:
would not God have discovered this,
since he knows the secrets of the heart?
44.22:
Yet for your sake we are killed all day long.
We are considered sheep to be slaughtered.
44.23:
Get up! Why do you sleep, O Lord? Wake up!
Do not reject us forever.
44.24:
Why do you hide your face?
Why do you forget our misery and our oppression?
44.25:
For our souls bow down to the dust.
Our bellies cling to the earth.
44.26:
Stand up! Help us!
Redeem us because of your mercy.

45.1:
For the choir director. According to “Lilies.”
By the Sons of Korah. A maskil. A love song.
45.2:
My heart is bubbling over with a beautiful theme.
I am reciting my works for the King.
My tongue is the pen of a rapid writer.
45.3:
You are the most beautiful of the sons of Adam.
Grace is poured out on your lips.
Therefore God has blessed you forever.
45.4:
Strap your sword on your thigh, you mighty warrior,
    in your splendor and your majesty.
45.5:
In your majesty advance successfully.
Ride forward in the cause of truth, humility, and righteousness.
Let your right hand teach you awesome deeds.
45.6:
Your arrows are sharpened.
Let peoples fall beneath you.
Your arrows are in the heart of the king’s enemies.
45.7:
Your throne, O God, is forever and ever.
The scepter of your kingdom is a scepter of justice.
45.8:
You love righteousness and hate wickedness.
Therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of joy
    more than any of your companions.
45.9:
Myrrh, aloes, and cassia perfume all your garments.
From ivory palaces stringed instruments make you glad.
45.10:
Daughters of kings are among your honored attendants.
The royal wife stands at your right hand in gold from Ophir.
45.11:
Hear, O daughter, look and listen.
Forget your people and your father’s house,
45.12:
because the king desires your beauty.
Because he is your lord, bow down to him.
45.13:
Then the daughter of Tyre will come with a gift.
The richest people will seek your favor.
45.14:
The princess, who waits inside, is all glorious.
Her dress is interwoven with gold.
45.15:
In embroidered garments she is led to the king.
Virgins who follow her as attendants are brought to you.
45.16:
They are brought with joyful celebration.
They enter the palace of the king.
45.17:
Your sons will take the place of your fathers.
You will make them princes in all the earth.
45.18:
I will preserve the memory of your name through all generations.
Therefore peoples will praise you forever and ever.

46.1:
God is our refuge and strength,
a helper who can always be found in times of trouble.
46.2:
That is why we will not fear when the earth dissolves
and when the mountains tumble into the heart of the sea.
46.3:
Its waters roar and foam.
The mountains quake when it rises. Interlude
46.4:
There is a river—its streams bring joy to the city of God,
to the holy dwelling of the Most High.
46.5:
God is in her. She will not fall.
God will help her at daybreak.
46.6:
Nations are in turmoil. Kingdoms fall.
God raises his voice. The earth melts.
46.7:
The Lord of Armies is with us.
The God of Jacob is a fortress for us. Interlude
46.8:
Come, look at the works of the Lord.
What a wasteland he has made of the earth!
46.9:
He makes wars cease to the end of the earth.
He shatters the bow. He cuts up the spear.
He burns the carts with fire.
46.10:
“Be still, and know that I am God.
I will be exalted among the nations.
I will be exalted on the earth.”
46.11:
The Lord of Armies is with us.
The God of Jacob is a fortress for us. Interlude

47.1:
All you peoples, clap your hands!
Shout to God! Sing a loud song!
47.2:
Yes, the Lord Most High is awesome.
He is the great King over all the earth!
47.3:
He subdues peoples under us
and nations under our feet.
47.4:
He chooses our inheritance for us.
It is the pride of Jacob, whom he loves. Interlude
47.5:
God has ascended with a joyful shout.
The Lord goes up with the sound of the ram’s horn.
47.6:
Make music for God! Make music!
Make music for our King! Make music!
47.7:
For God is the King of all the earth.
Make music for him with a wise song.
47.8:
God reigns as king over the nations.
God is seated on his holy throne.
47.9:
The nobles of the peoples come together
    as the people of the God of Abraham.
Yes, the shields of the earth belong to God.
He is greatly exalted.

48.1:
The Lord is great. He deserves to be praised
    in the city of our God, on his holy mountain.
48.2:
His mountain is lofty and beautiful, the joy of the whole earth.
Mount Zion, the northern mountain, is the city of the Great King.
48.3:
God is in her citadels.
He is famous as her fortress.
48.4:
Look! See! The kings came together.
They advanced together.
48.5:
They saw. Yes, they were amazed.
They were terrified. They were put to flight.
48.6:
Trembling seized them there,
pain like a woman giving birth.
48.7: You shattered them with an east wind, like ships of Tarshish.
48.8:
What we have heard, we now have also seen:
    In the city of the Lord of Armies,
    in the city of our God, Interlude
    God establishes her forever.
48.9: Inside your temple, O God, we meditate on your mercy.
48.10:
Your praise, O God, reaches to the ends of the earth,
just as your fame does.
Righteousness fills your right hand.
48.11:
Mount Zion rejoices.
The daughters of Judah celebrate because of your judgments.
48.12:
Go around Zion. Yes, go all the way around her.
Count her towers.
48.13:
Consider her rampart.
View her citadels, so that you may tell the next generation about them.
48.14:
For this God is our God forever and ever.
He will guide us beyond death.

49.1:
Hear this, all you peoples.
Pay attention, all you inhabitants of this world,
49.2:
all you children of Adam, all mankind,
rich and poor alike.
49.3:
My mouth will speak wisdom.
The meditation of my heart will give understanding.
49.4:
I will listen carefully to wise teaching.
With a lyre I will explain deep truths.
49.5:
Why should I fear days of trouble,
days when the wickedness of my pursuers surrounds me?
49.6:
They trust in their wealth.
They place their confidence in the abundance of their riches.
49.7:
But no one can by any means redeem himself.
He cannot give God a ransom for himself—
49.8:
(Yes, the ransom for their souls is costly.
Any payment would fall short.)
49.9: —so that he could live on forever and not see the pit.
49.10:
Yes, we can see that wise men die.
The fool and the senseless alike perish,
and they leave their wealth to others.
49.11:
They think their houses will remain forever,
their dwellings for generation after generation
because they named lands after themselves.
49.12:
But man, though he has riches, does not even spend a night here.
He is like the animals that perish.
49.13:
This way of theirs is foolishness,
but their followers approve of what they say. Interlude
49.14:
They are like a flock destined for the grave.
Death will be their shepherd.
The upright will rule over them in the morning.
Their bodies will be consumed by the grave,
    far from their mansions.
49.15:
But surely God will redeem my life from the power of the grave.
Yes, he will take me to himself. Interlude
49.16:
Do not be afraid when a man grows rich,
when the glory of his house increases,
49.17:
because when he dies, he cannot take anything along.
His glory will not go down with him.
49.18:
Throughout his life he congratulates himself:
“People praise you because you have done so well for yourself.”
49.19:
He will go to the gathering place of his fathers.
They will never see the light!
49.20:
A man who has riches but does not understand
    is like the animals that perish.

50.2:
God, God the Lord, has spoken.
He calls to the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.
50.3: From Zion, the perfection of beauty, God has shined.
50.4:
Our God comes and he will not be silent.
Fire devours in front of him.
Around him a storm rages.
50.5:
He calls to the heavens above and to the earth
    to judge his people.
50.6:
“Gather to me my favored ones,
who make a covenant with me by sacrifice.”
50.7:
So the heavens proclaim his righteousness,
    because God himself is judge. Interlude
50.8:
Listen, my people, and let me speak, O Israel.
Then I will testify against you:
I am God, your God.
50.9:
It is not because of your sacrifices that I rebuke you
or because of your burnt offerings that are always in front of me.
50.10:
I do not need to take a bull from your barn
    or goats from your pens,
50.11:
because every animal in the forest is mine,
the cattle on a thousand mountains.
50.12:
I know every bird in the mountains,
and everything that moves in the field is with me.
50.13:
If I were hungry, I would not tell you,
because the world is mine, and all that fills it.
50.14:
Do I eat the flesh of bulls,
or do I drink the blood of goats?
50.15:
Sacrifice a thank offering to God,
and fulfill your vows to the Most High.
50.16:
Call on me in the day of distress.
I will deliver you, and you will honor me.
50.17:
But to the wicked, God says:
What right do you have to recite my statutes
or to take up my covenant with your mouth?
50.18:
As for you—you hate discipline,
and you throw my words behind your back.
50.19:
If you see a thief, you approve of him,
and you cast your lot with adulterers.
50.20:
You devote your mouth to evil,
and your tongue weaves deceit.
50.21:
You sit and speak against your brother.
You slander your own mother’s son.
50.22:
These things you have done, and I kept silent.
You thought I was just like you.
I will indict you and accuse you to your face.
50.23:
Now consider this, you who forget God,
or I will tear you to pieces,
and there will be no one to rescue you.
50.24:
The one who sacrifices a thank offering honors me,
and he sets up the way by which I will show him the salvation of God.

51.1:
Be gracious to me, God,
    according to your mercy.
Erase my acts of rebellion
    according to the greatness of your compassion.
51.2:
Scrub me clean from my guilt.
Purify me from my sin.
51.3:
For I admit my rebellious acts.
My sin is always in front of me.
51.4:
Against you, you only, have I sinned,
and I have done this evil in your eyes.
So you are justified when you sentence me.
You are blameless when you judge.
51.5:
Certainly, I was guilty when I was born.
I was sinful when my mother conceived me.
51.6:
Since you desire truth on the inside,
in my hidden heart you teach me wisdom.
51.7:
Remove my sin with hyssop, and I will be clean.
Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
51.8:
Let me hear joy and gladness.
Let the bones you have crushed celebrate.
51.9:
Hide your face from my sins.
Erase all my guilty deeds.
51.10:
Create in me a pure heart, O God.
Renew an unwavering spirit within me.
51.11:
Do not cast me from your presence.
Do not take your Holy Spirit from me.
51.12:
Restore to me the joy of your salvation.
Sustain me with a willing spirit.
51.13:
I will teach rebels your ways,
and sinners will turn to you.
51.14:
Deliver me from bloodshed, O God,
    the God who saves me.
My tongue will shout for joy about your righteousness.
51.15:
Lord, open my lips,
and my mouth will declare your praise.
51.16:
For you do not delight in sacrifice,
or I would give it.
You do not take pleasure in burnt offerings.
51.17:
The sacrifices God wants are a broken spirit.
A broken and crushed heart, O God, you will not despise.
51.18:
As it pleases you, do good for Zion.
Build up the walls of Jerusalem.
51.19:
Then you will be pleased with righteous sacrifices,
    burnt offerings and whole offerings.
Then bulls will be offered up on your altar.

52.1:
Why do you boast about evil, you hero?
The mercy of God endures all day long.
52.2:
Your tongue plans destruction.
It is like a sharpened razor, you scheming liar.
52.3:
You love evil rather than good. Interlude
You love lying rather than speaking what is right.
52.4: You lying tongue, you love every word that devours!
52.5:
But God will tear you down forever.
He will grab you and pull you out of your tent. Interlude
He will uproot you from the land of the living.
52.6:
Then the righteous will see and fear.
Then they will laugh at him:
52.7:
“Look, here is the man who did not make God his stronghold,
but trusted in the greatness of his wealth.
He grew strong by his destructive deeds!”
52.8:
But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God.
I trust in the mercy of God forever and ever.
52.9:
I will thank you forever because you have done this.
I will hope in your name in the presence of your favored ones
    because it is good.

53.1:
