in order to cut off every evildoer from the city of the Lord.

102.1:
O Lord, hear my prayer,
and let my cry for help come to you.
102.2:
Do not hide your face from me on the day when I am distressed.
Turn your ear to me on the day I call.
Hurry! Answer me!
102.3:
For my days go up in smoke,
and my bones are burned like hot coals.
102.4:
My heart is cut down and withered like grass,
so I forget to eat my food.
102.5: Because of the sound of my groaning, my bones stick out of my flesh.
102.6:
I am like an owl in the wilderness,
like a screech owl among the ruins.
102.7:
I lie awake.
I have become like a lonely bird on a roof.
102.8:
All day long my enemies taunt me.
Those who ridicule me use my name as a curse,
102.9:
because I eat ashes like bread,
and I mix tears with my drinks.
102.10:
Because of your rage and your wrath,
    you have picked me up and thrown me away.
102.11:
My days are being stretched out like a shadow,
and I am dried up like grass.
102.12:
But you, Lord, sit on your throne forever,
and you will be remembered through all generations.
102.13:
You will rise and have compassion on Zion.
Yes, it is time to be gracious to her,
because the appointed time has come.
102.14:
Yes, your servants will show favor to her stones,
and they will have compassion on her dust.
102.15:
Then the nations will fear the name of the Lord,
and all the kings of the earth will fear your glory.
102.16:
For the Lord will rebuild Zion.
He will appear in his glory.
102.17:
He will respond to the prayer of the naked.
He will not despise their prayer.
102.18:
Let this be written till the last generation,
so that a people not yet created may praise the Lord.
102.19:
For the Lord looked down from his high, holy place.
From heaven he viewed the earth
102.20:
to hear the groans of the prisoner,
    to release those condemned to death.
102.21:
So the name of the Lord will be recorded in Zion
and his praise in Jerusalem,
102.22:
when the peoples and the kingdoms are gathered together
    to serve the Lord.
102.23:
He took away my strength during my lifetime.
He cut short my days.
102.24:
I said, “My God, do not take me away in the middle of my days.”
Your years go on through all generations.
102.25:
Long ago you laid a foundation for the earth,
and the heavens are the work of your hands.
102.26:
They will perish, but you remain.
All of them wear out like a garment.
Like clothing you will change them,
and they will be changed.
102.27:
But you are the same,
and your years will never end.
102.28:
The children of your servants will dwell with you,
and their descendants will be established before you.

103.1:
Bless the Lord, O my soul.
All that is within me, bless his holy name.
103.2:
Bless the Lord, O my soul,
and do not forget all his benefits—
103.3:
who pardons all your guilt,
who heals all your diseases,
103.4:
who redeems your life from the pit,
who crowns you with mercy and compassion,
103.5:
who satisfies your life with goodness,
so that your youth is renewed like the eagle.
103.6: The Lord performs righteousness and justice for all the oppressed.
103.7:
He made known his ways to Moses,
his deeds to the people of Israel.
103.8:
The Lord is compassionate and gracious,
slow to anger, abounding in mercy.
103.9:
He will not always accuse.
He will not keep his anger forever.
103.10:
He does not treat us as our sins deserve.
He does not repay us according to our guilty deeds.
103.11:
Yes, as high as the heavens are above the earth,
    so powerful is his mercy toward those who fear him.
103.12:
As distant as the east is from the west,
    so far has he removed our rebellious acts from us.
103.13:
As a father has compassion on his children,
    so the Lord has compassion on those who fear him.
103.14:
For he knows how we were formed.
He remembers that we are dust.
103.15:
As for man, his days are like grass.
Like a wildflower he blossoms.
103.16:
Then the wind blows over it, and it is gone,
and its place recognizes it no more.
103.17:
But the Lord’s mercy is from eternity to eternity
    over those who fear him,
and his righteousness is with their children’s children,
103.18:
with those who keep his covenant,
    with those who remember his precepts in order to obey them.
103.19:
The Lord has established his throne in the heavens,
and his royal power rules over all.
103.20:
Bless the Lord, you his angels,
you strong warriors who obey his word
    by listening to what he says.
103.21:
Bless the Lord, all his armies,
you who minister to him,
you who do whatever pleases him.
103.22:
Bless the Lord, everything he has made
    in all places where he rules.
Bless the Lord, O my soul.

104.1:
Bless the Lord, O my soul.
O Lord my God, you are very great.
You are clothed with splendor and majesty.
104.2:
He wears light like a robe.
He stretches out the heavens like a canopy.
104.3:
He lays beams on the waters to support his upper chambers.
He makes clouds his chariot.
He travels on the wings of the wind.
104.4:
He makes his messengers winds.
His ministers are blazing fire.
104.5:
He placed the earth firmly on its foundations.
It cannot be moved forever and ever.
104.6:
You covered it with the deep as a garment.
The waters stood above the mountains.
104.7:
At your rebuke they fled.
At the sound of your thunder they hurried away.
104.8:
The waters surged up the mountains.
They went down into the valleys,
to the place that you prepared for them.
104.9:
You set a boundary that they cannot cross.
They will not return to cover the earth.
104.10:
He makes springs flow into streams
    that run between the mountains.
104.11:
They give water to every wild animal.
The wild donkeys quench their thirst.
104.12:
The birds of the sky live by the streams.
From among the branches they send out their song.
104.13:
He waters the mountains from his upper chambers.
The earth is filled with the fruit he produces.
104.14:
He makes grass grow for the cattle,
and plants that people use to produce food from the earth.
104.15:
Also wine that makes people’s hearts glad,
olive oil to make their face shine,
and bread that sustains their lives.
104.16:
The trees of the Lord have everything they need.
He planted the cedars of Lebanon,
104.17:
where birds make their nests.
The stork has its home in the fir trees.
104.18:
The high mountains are for the wild goats.
The crags are a refuge for the rock badgers.
104.19:
The moon marks off the months and seasons.
The sun knows when to go down.
104.20:
You bring darkness, and it becomes night.
During it all the animals in the forest move about.
104.21:
The young lions roar for their prey.
They are seeking their food from God.
104.22:
The sun rises, and they gather together.
They return to their dens and lie down.
104.23:
Man goes out to his work.
He continues his labor until evening.
104.24:
How many are your works, O Lord!
In wisdom you made them all.
The earth is full of your creatures.
104.25:
Here is the sea, great and very wide.
In it creatures swarm beyond number—
living things, the small with the large.
104.26:
There the ships go back and forth,
and the leviathan that you formed to play in it.
104.27: All of them wait hopefully for you to give them their food in its time.
104.28:
You give it to them. They gather it up.
You open your hand. They are satisfied with good things.
104.29:
You hide your face. They are terrified.
You take away their breath.
They breathe their last and return to their dust.
104.30:
You send your Spirit—they are created.
You renew the face of the earth.
104.31:
May the glory of the Lord endure forever.
May the Lord rejoice in his works.
104.32:
He looks at the earth and it trembles.
He touches the mountains and they smoke.
104.33:
I will sing to the Lord throughout my life.
I will make music to my God as long as I last.
104.34:
May my meditation be pleasing to him.
I will rejoice in the Lord.
104.35:
May sinners come to an end on the earth,
and the wicked—may they be no more.
Bless the Lord, O my soul.
Praise the Lord!

105.1:
Give thanks to the Lord.
Proclaim his name.
Make his deeds known among the peoples.
105.2:
Sing to him, make music to him.
Meditate on all his wonders.
105.3:
Take pride in his holy name.
Let the heart of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
105.4:
Search for the Lord and his strength.
Seek his face always.
105.5:
Remember the wonders which he has done,
his signs, and the judgments from his mouth,
105.6:
you descendants of Abraham his servant,
you sons of Jacob, his chosen ones.
105.7:
He is the Lord our God.
His judgments are in all the earth.
105.8:
He remembers his covenant forever,
the word he commanded for a thousand generations,
105.9:
the covenant which he made with Abraham,
and his oath to Isaac.
105.10:
Yes, he confirmed it to Jacob as a statute,
to Israel as an everlasting covenant.
105.11:
He said, “To you I will give the land of Canaan,
the territory you will possess.”
105.12:
While they were few in number,
just a little group and aliens in the land,
105.13:
they moved around from nation to nation,
from one kingdom to another people.
105.14:
He did not allow anyone to oppress them,
and he rebuked kings because of them:
105.15:
“Do not touch my anointed ones,
and do not harm my prophets.”
105.16:
Then he summoned a famine on the land.
He destroyed their entire food supply.
105.17: He sent ahead of them a man sold as a slave, Joseph.
105.18:
They hurt his feet with chains.
His throat was clamped in an iron collar,
105.19:
until the time when his predictions came true.
The promise of the Lord tested him.
105.20:
The king sent for him and released him.
The ruler of peoples set him free.
105.21:
He made him master of his house
and ruler over all his possessions,
105.22:
to bind his officials by his will,
to teach his elders wisdom.
105.23:
Then Israel came to Egypt.
Jacob lived as an alien in the land of Ham.
105.24:
Then the Lord made his people very fruitful.
He made them too numerous for their foes.
105.25:
He turned the Egyptians’ hearts so they hated his people.
They dealt deceitfully with his servants.
105.26:
He sent Moses his servant,
and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
105.27:
They performed his signs among them,
his warning signs in the land of Ham.
105.28:
He sent darkness, and it became extremely dark,
because Israel did not rebel against his words.
105.29:
He turned their waters into blood,
and he caused their fish to die.
105.30:
Their land swarmed with frogs,
even in the rooms of their kings.
105.31:
He spoke, and a swarm of flies came.
There were lice throughout their borders.
105.32:
He gave them hail instead of rain,
with blazing lightning throughout their land.
105.33:
Then he struck down their vines and fig trees,
and he broke down the trees within their borders.
105.34:
He spoke, and the locusts came,
and grasshoppers without number.
105.35:
They ate every green plant in their land.
They ate the produce of their soil.
105.36:
Then he struck down all the firstborn in their land,
the first fruit of all their virility.
105.37:
Then he brought Israel out with silver and gold.
From among their tribes no one stumbled.
105.38:
Egypt was glad when they went out,
because fear of Israel had fallen on them.
105.39:
He spread out a cloud as a canopy
and fire to give light at night.
105.40:
They asked, and he brought quail,
and he satisfied them with bread from heaven.
105.41:
He opened the rock, and water gushed out.
It flowed in the desert like a river.
105.42: Because he remembered his holy word to Abraham, his servant,
105.43:
he brought out his people with rejoicing,
his chosen ones with a joyful shout.
105.44:
He gave them the lands of the nations,
and they took possession of the work of other peoples
105.45:
so that they could keep his statutes and observe his laws.
Praise the Lord.

106.1:
Praise the Lord.
Give thanks to the Lord,
for he is good,
for his mercy endures forever.
106.2:
Who can tell about the mighty deeds of the Lord?
Who can cause all his praise to be heard?
106.3:
Blessed are those who defend justice,
who do what is right all the time.
106.4:
Remember me, O Lord,
when you show favor to your people.
Visit me with your salvation,
106.5:
so that I may experience the good that belongs to your chosen ones,
so that I may rejoice in the joy of your nation,
so that I may join in praise with the people that belongs to you.
106.6:
We have sinned along with our fathers.
We have become guilty. We have acted wickedly.
106.7:
Our fathers in Egypt did not reflect on your wonders.
They did not remember your abundant mercies,
so they rebelled beside the sea, by the Red Sea.
106.8:
Nevertheless, he saved them for his name’s sake,
    to make his might known.
106.9:
Then he rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up.
He caused them to go through the deep sea as if it were a desert.
106.10:
He saved them from the hand of the one who hated them.
He redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
106.11:
Then the waters covered their foes.
Not one of them remained.
106.12: Then they believed his words. They sang his praise.
106.13:
They quickly forgot his deeds.
They did not wait for his plan.
106.14:
Because they were filled with craving in the wilderness,
they challenged God in the wasteland.
106.15:
So he gave them what they asked for,
but he made them sick so they wasted away.
106.16:
Then they grew jealous of Moses in the camp
and of Aaron, who was holy to the Lord.
106.17:
The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan,
and it closed over the followers of Abiram.
106.18:
Then fire burned up their followers.
Flames consumed the wicked.
106.19:
They made a calf at Horeb,
and they bowed down to a thing cast from metal.
106.20: So they exchanged their Glory for a model of an ox that eats grass.
106.21:
They forgot the God who saved them
    by doing great things in Egypt,
106.22:
wonders in the land of Ham,
    awesome deeds beside the Red Sea.
106.23:
So he said he would destroy them.
But Moses, his chosen one, stood between God and the people
    to turn aside his wrath, so it did not destroy them.
106.24:
Then they refused the pleasant land.
They did not believe his word.
106.25:
They grumbled in their tents.
They did not listen to the voice of the Lord.
106.26:
So he lifted up his hand and swore to them
    that he would make them fall in the wilderness,
106.27:
and make their descendants fall among the nations,
    and he would scatter them throughout the lands.
106.28:
Then they yoked themselves to the Baal of Peor,
and they ate sacrifices offered to dead gods.
106.29:
They provoked the Lord by their actions,
and a plague broke out among them.
106.30:
But Phinehas stood up and interceded for them,
and the plague was restrained.
106.31:
So this was credited to him as righteousness
for generation after generation, to eternity.
106.32:
Again by the waters of Meribah they provoked the Lord,
and trouble came on Moses because of them.
106.33:
Because they rebelled against his Spirit,
Moses spoke recklessly with his lips.
106.34:
They did not destroy the peoples
as the Lord had commanded them,
106.35:
but they mixed with the nations,
and they learned to do what the nations did.
106.36:
They also served their idols,
and the idols became a snare for them.
106.37: They also sacrificed their sons and daughters to demons.
106.38:
They shed innocent blood,
the blood of their sons and daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan.
So the land was polluted by their children’s blood,
106.39:
and they made themselves unclean by what they did.
They prostituted themselves by their actions.
106.40:
Therefore the Lord burned with anger against his people,
and he loathed the people who belonged to him.
106.41:
So he handed them over to the nations,
and those who hated them ruled over them.
106.42:
Then their enemies oppressed them,
and they had to submit to their power.
106.43:
Many times he delivered them,
but they deliberately rebelled,
and they sank down in their guilt.
106.44: But he looked on them in their distress when he heard their outcry.
106.45:
So for their sake he remembered his covenant.
Because of his great mercy, he changed his course.
106.46: Then he caused all their captors to have pity on them.
106.47:
Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from the nations,
so that we may give thanks to your holy name and praise you confidently.
106.48:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from eternity to eternity,
and all the people say, “Amen!”
Praise the Lord.

107.1:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
for his mercy endures forever.
107.2:
Let the redeemed of the Lord say this,
those he redeemed from the hand of the foe,
107.4:
They wandered in the wilderness, in the wasteland.
They did not find the way to a city where they could live.
107.5:
They were hungry and also thirsty,
so their lives were draining away.
107.6:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their distress.
He delivered them from their troubles.
107.7: He led them by a straight way to come to a city where they could live.
107.8:
Let them give thanks to the Lord
for his mercy and his wonderful deeds for all people,
107.9:
because he satisfies the desire of the thirsty,
and he fills the desire of the hungry with good things.
107.10:
They were sitting in darkness and the shadow of death,
prisoners, bound in misery and chains,
107.11:
because they had rebelled against the words of God,
and they despised the plan of the Most High.
107.12:
So he broke their hearts with hard labor.
They stumbled, and there was no helper.
107.13:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their distress.
He saved them from their troubles.
107.14:
He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death,
and he tore off their chains.
107.15:
Let them give thanks to the Lord
for his mercy and his wonderful deeds for all people,
107.16:
because he shatters bronze doors,
and he cuts through iron bars.
107.17:
They became fools through their rebellious way,
and they brought affliction on themselves by their guilt.
107.18:
They lost their appetite for food,
    so they approached the gates of death.
107.19:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their distress.
He saved them from their troubles.
107.20:
He sent his word and healed them.
He rescued them from the pits that trapped them.
107.21:
Let them give thanks to the Lord
for his mercy and his wonderful deeds for all people,
107.22:
so let them sacrifice thank offerings
and tell about his works with a joyful shout.
107.23:
They went down to the sea in ships.
They conducted trade on many waters.
107.24:
They saw the deeds of the Lord
and his wonders on the deep.
107.25:
For he spoke and stirred up a violent storm,
    which produced large waves.
107.26:
They were raised up to the sky.
They sank down into the depths.
In their danger their courage melted.
107.27:
They reeled and staggered like a drunk.
All their skill disappeared.
107.28:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their distress.
He brought them out of their troubles.
107.29: He calmed the storm. Its waves were hushed.
107.30:
They were glad when it grew quiet,
and he guided them to the port they desired.
107.31:
Let them give thanks to the Lord
for his mercy and his wonderful deeds for all people.
107.32:
Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people
and praise him in the session of the elders.
107.33:
He turned rivers into a wilderness
and flowing springs into thirsty ground.
107.34:
He turned fruitful land into a salt waste,
because of the wickedness of those who lived in it.
107.35:
He turned the wilderness into pools of water
and the desert into flowing springs.
107.36:
Then he let the hungry live there,
and they founded a city where they could live.
107.37:
Then they sowed fields, and they planted vineyards,
    which produced abundant fruit.
107.38:
Then he blessed them, so they increased greatly in number.
He did not let their herds of cattle decrease.
107.39:
But then their numbers decreased,
and they were humbled by oppression, disaster, and sorrow.
107.40:
He who pours contempt on nobles made them wander in confusion
    where there was no road.
107.41:
But he lifted up the needy out of affliction
and made their families like a flock.
107.42:
The upright see and rejoice,
but all wickedness shuts its mouth.
107.43:
Whoever is wise, let him keep these things.
Let them take to heart the mercies of the Lord.

108.1:
My heart is steadfast, O God.
I will sing and I will make music.
Indeed, I will sing with all my being.
108.2:
Awake, harp and lyre!
I will awaken the dawn.
108.3:
I will give you thanks among the peoples, Lord,
and I will make music to you among the nations,
108.4:
because your great mercy reaches above the heavens,
and your faithfulness to the skies.
108.5:
Be exalted above the heavens, O God.
Let your glory be over all the earth.
108.6:
So that the ones you love may be rescued,
bring salvation by your right hand and answer me.
108.7:
God has spoken in his holiness.
I will triumph. I will distribute Shechem,
and I will measure off the Valley of Succoth.
108.8:
Gilead is mine. Manasseh is mine.
Ephraim is my helmet. Judah is my scepter.
108.9:
Moab is my washbasin. On Edom I toss my sandal.
I shout aloud over Philistia.
108.10:
Who will bring me into the fortified city?
Who will lead me to Edom?
108.11:
Is it not you, O God, who have rejected us?
Is it not you, O God, who no longer go out with our armies?
108.12:
Give us help against the foe,
for human help is worthless.
108.13:
In God we will do mighty deeds.
He is the one who will trample our foes.

109.1: O God whom I praise, do not be silent,
109.2:
because they have opened wicked, deceitful mouths against me.
They have spoken against me with lying tongues.
109.3:
They surround me with hateful words.
They attack me without cause.
109.4:
In return for my love they accuse me,
but I am a man of prayer.
109.5:
They repay me with evil for good,
with hatred for my love.
109.6:
Appoint an evil one to testify against him,
and let an accuser stand at his right hand.
109.7:
When he is tried, let him be found guilty,
and let his prayer be sin.
109.8:
Let his days be few.
Let another take his office.
109.9:
Let his children be fatherless
and his wife a widow.
109.10:
Let his children always wander and beg.
Let them seek food far from their ruined homes.
109.11:
Let a creditor confiscate all he has.
Let strangers plunder everything he worked for.
109.12:
Let there be no one to extend mercy to him.
Let there be no one to show favor to his fatherless children.
109.13:
Let his descendants be cut off.
In the next generation let their name be blotted out.
109.14:
Let the guilt of his fathers be remembered before the Lord.
Let the sin of his mother never be blotted out.
109.15:
Let their sins remain before the Lord continually,
and let the memory of these people be cut off from the earth.
109.16:
Because he did not remember to show mercy,
but he pursued the poor man and the needy
    and the brokenhearted to put them to death.
109.17:
Since he loved cursing, so let it fall on him.
He found no pleasure in blessing, so let it be far from him.
109.18:
Since he wore cursing as his clothing,
let it enter into his stomach like water
and into his bones like oil.
109.19:
Let it be like a garment wrapped around him,
like a belt tied around him forever.
109.20:
May the Lord do all this to my accusers
and to those who speak evil against my life.
109.21:
But you, Lord God, deal with me for the sake of your name.
Because of the goodness of your mercy, deliver me.
109.22:
For I am poor and needy,
and my heart is wounded within me.
109.23:
Like a shadow after it lengthens, I go away.
I am shaken off like a locust.
109.24:
My knees give way from fasting,
and my flesh has become lean, without fat.
109.25:
But I—I am scorned by them.
They see me. They shake their heads.
109.26:
Help me, O Lord my God.
Save me according to your mercy.
109.27:
Let them know that this is your hand.
You, O Lord, have done it.
109.28:
They may curse, but you will bless.
They rose up, but they will be put to shame.
Then your servant will rejoice.
109.29:
My accusers will be dressed with disgrace.
Their shame will wrap around them like a robe.
109.30:
With my mouth I will keep on thanking the Lord.
In the midst of many people I will praise him.
109.31:
For the Lord stands at the right hand of the needy,
    to save his life from those who condemn him.

110.1:
The decree of the Lord to my lord:
“Sit at my right hand until I make your enemies
    a footstool under your feet.”
110.2:
The Lord will stretch out your strong scepter from Zion.
Rule in the midst of your enemies.
110.3:
Your people will be willing on the day of your power.
In majesty of holiness, from the womb of the dawn,
    the dew of your youth will be yours.
110.4:
The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind:
“You are a priest forever, in the manner of Melchizedek.”
110.5:
The Lord is at your right hand.
He will crush kings on the day of his wrath.
110.6:
He will judge the nations.
He will fill valleys with corpses.
He will crush heads over the wide world.
110.7:
He will drink from a stream beside the way;
therefore, he will lift up his head.

111.1:
Praise the Lord.
I will thank the Lord with all my heart
    in the assembly of the upright and in the congregation.
111.2:
Great are the deeds of the Lord.
They are studied by all who delight in them.
111.3:
Glorious and majestic is his work,
and his righteousness stands forever.
111.4:
He has set up a memorial to his wonders.
Gracious and compassionate is the Lord.
111.5:
He gives food to those who fear him.
He remembers his covenant forever.
111.6:
He has declared the power of his deeds to his people,
    to give them the nations as their possession.
111.7:
The works of his hands are truth and justice.
All his precepts are trustworthy,
111.8:
steadfast forever and ever,
done in truth and uprightness.
111.9:
He sent redemption for his people.
He commanded his covenant forever.
Holy and awesome is his name.
111.10:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom.
All who do his precepts have good understanding.
His praise stands forever.

112.1:
Praise the Lord.
How blessed is a man who fears the Lord.
In his commands he delights greatly.
112.2:
His descendants will be mighty in the land.
The circle of the upright will be blessed.
112.3:
Wealth and riches are in his house,
and his righteousness stands forever.
112.4:
In darkness, light dawns for the upright.
He is gracious and compassionate and righteous.
112.5:
Good things will come to the man
    who is gracious and lends,
    who conducts his business with justice.
112.6:
Surely he will never fall.
The righteous will be remembered forever.
112.7:
He will not fear bad news.
His heart is steadfast, trusting in the Lord.
112.8:
His heart is secure.
He will have no fear, until he looks in triumph on his foes.
112.9:
He scatters seed—he gives to the poor.
His righteousness stands forever.
His horn will be lifted high in glory.
112.10:
The wicked person will see and be frustrated.
He will gnash his teeth and melt away.
The desire of the wicked will perish.

113.1:
Praise the Lord.
Praise, you servants of the Lord,
praise the name of the Lord.
113.2: Let the name of the Lord be blessed, from now to eternity.
113.3:
From the rising of the sun to its setting,
    the name of the Lord is to be praised.
113.4:
High above all the nations is the Lord.
His glory towers above the heavens.
113.5:
Who is like the Lord our God?
He is seated on high.
113.6: He bends down to look at the heavens and at the earth.
113.7:
He raises the poor from the dust.
He lifts the needy from the garbage pile
113.8:
to seat them with nobles,
    with the nobles of his people.
113.9:
He is the one who settles the barren woman in her home
    as a joyful mother of children.
Praise the Lord.

114.1:
When Israel came out of Egypt
and the house of Jacob from a people with a strange language,
114.2:
Judah became his sanctuary,
Israel became his kingdom.
114.3:
The sea saw and fled.
The Jordan turned back.
114.4:
The mountains skipped like rams,
the hills like lambs.
114.5:
What happened, O sea, that you fled,
O Jordan, that you turned back,
114.6:
O mountains, that you skipped like rams,
you hills, like lambs?
114.7:
Tremble in the presence of the Lord, O earth.
Tremble in the presence of the God of Jacob.
114.8:
He turned the rock into a pool of water.
He turned flint into springs of water.

115.1:
Not to us, O Lord, not to us,
but to your name give glory,
because of your mercy,
because of your truth.
115.2:
Why should the nations say,
“So where is their God now?”
115.3:
In fact, our God is in the heavens.
He does everything that pleases him.
115.4: Their idols are silver and gold, the work of human hands.
115.5:
They have a mouth, but they do not speak.
They have eyes, but they do not see.
115.6:
They have ears, but they do not hear.
They have a nose, but they do not smell.
115.7:
Their hands—they do not even feel.
Their feet—they do not even walk around.
They do not even make a sound with their throats.
115.8:
Those who make them will be like them,
and so will all who trust in them.
115.9:
Israel, trust in the Lord—
he is their help and their shield.
115.10:
House of Aaron, trust in the Lord—
he is their help and their shield.
115.11:
You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord—
he is their help and their shield.
115.12:
The Lord remembers us. He will bless.
He will bless the house of Israel.
He will bless the house of Aaron.
115.13:
He will bless those who fear the Lord—
the small with the great.
115.14:
May the Lord add blessings to you,
to you and to your children.
115.15:
May you be blessed by the Lord,
the Maker of heaven and earth.
115.16:
The heavens are heavens for the Lord,
but the earth he gave to the children of Adam.
115.17:
It is not the dead who praise the Lord,
nor any of those who go down to silence,
115.18:
but we are the ones who bless the Lord,
    from now to eternity.
Praise the Lord.

116.1:
I love the Lord, because he hears my voice.
He hears my cry for mercy.
116.2:
Because he turned his ear to me,
I will call to him all my days.
116.3:
The ropes of death entangled me.
The walls of the grave hemmed me in.
I found distress and sorrow.
116.4:
Then I called on the name of the Lord:
“Ah, Lord, please save my life!”
116.5:
The Lord is gracious and righteous,
and our God is compassionate.
116.6:
The Lord protects the inexperienced.
In my weakness he saves me too.
116.7:
Return, my soul, to your rest,
for the Lord has accomplished his purpose for you.
116.8:
Indeed, you have delivered my soul from death,
my eye from weeping, my foot from stumbling,
116.9: so that I may walk before the Lord in the land of the living.
116.10:
I believed. Therefore, I have spoken:
“I am greatly afflicted.”
116.11:
In my haste I said:
“All people are deceptive.”
116.12: How can I repay the Lord for all his benefits to me?
116.13:
I will lift up the cup of salvation,
and I will call on the name of the Lord.
116.14:
I will fulfill my vows to the Lord,
now in the presence of all his people.
116.15: Precious in the eyes of the Lord is the death of his favored ones.
116.16:
Ah, Lord, truly I am your servant.
I am your servant, the son of your maidservant.
You opened my chains.
116.17:
To you I will sacrifice a thank offering,
and I will call on the name of the Lord.
116.18:
I will fulfill my vows to the Lord
    here in the presence of all his people,
116.19:
in the courtyards of the house of the Lord,
    in the middle of Jerusalem.
Praise the Lord.

117.1:
Praise the Lord, all you nations.
Worship him, every race of people.
117.2:
For his mercy overwhelms us,
and the faithfulness of the Lord endures forever.
Praise the Lord.

118.1:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
for his mercy endures forever.
118.2: Let Israel say now: Yes, his mercy endures forever.
118.3: Let the house of Aaron say now: Yes, his mercy endures forever.
118.4: Let those who fear the Lord say now: Yes, his mercy endures forever.
118.5:
Under pressure I cried to the Lord.
The Lord answered me.
He set me in a wide-open space.
118.6:
The Lord is with me.
I will not be afraid.
What can people do to me?
118.7:
The Lord, who is with me, is my helper,
so I will look in triumph on my enemies.
118.8:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
    than to trust in people.
118.9:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
    than to trust in human benefactors.
118.10:
All the nations surrounded me,
but in the name of the Lord I cut them off.
118.11:
They surrounded me, yes, they surrounded me,
but in the name of the Lord I cut them off.
118.12:
They surrounded me like bees,
but they were extinguished as quickly as a fire of thorns.
In the name of the Lord I cut them off.
118.13:
You pushed me hard to make me fall,
but the Lord helped me.
118.14:
My strength and song is the Lord,
and he has become salvation for me.
118.15:
Loud shouts of victory are heard in the tents of the righteous:
“The right hand of the Lord has done a mighty deed!
118.16:
The right hand of the Lord is lifted high!
The right hand of the Lord has done a mighty deed!”
118.17:
I will not die. No, I will live,
and I will proclaim the works of the Lord.
118.18:
The Lord has chastened me severely,
but he has not handed me over to death.
118.19:
Open for me the gates of righteousness.
I will enter them. I will give thanks to the Lord.
118.20:
This is the gate to the Lord.
The righteous enter it.
118.21:
I will give you thanks,
because you answered me,
and you have become salvation for me.
118.22: The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
118.23:
This is from the Lord.
It is marvelous in our eyes.
118.24:
This is the day the Lord has made.
Let us rejoice and be glad in it.
118.25:
O Lord, please save us now.
O Lord, grant us success.
118.26:
Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.
We bless you from the house of the Lord.
118.27:
The Lord is God,
and he makes light shine on us.
Bind the festival with branches as far as the horns of the altar.
118.28:
You are my God, and I will give you thanks.
You are my God, and I will exalt you.
118.29:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
for his mercy endures forever.

119.1:
How blessed are those who are blameless in their way,
who walk in the law of the Lord.
119.2:
How blessed are those who keep his testimonies.
With all their heart they seek him.
119.3:
Indeed, they do no wrong.
They walk in his ways.
119.4: You have commanded that your precepts be kept completely.
119.5: If only my ways were unwavering in keeping your statutes!
119.6: Then I would not be put to shame when I consider all your commands.
119.7:
I will thank you with an upright heart
    as I learn your righteous judgments.
119.8:
I will keep your statutes.
Do not abandon me completely.
119.9:
How can a young man keep his path pure?
By guarding it with your words.
119.10:
With all my heart I seek you.
Do not let me stray from your commands.
119.11:
I have hidden your sayings in my heart,
    so that I may not sin against you.
119.12:
Blessed are you, O Lord!
Teach me your statutes.
119.13:
With my lips I tell about all the judgments
    that come from your mouth.
119.14:
I rejoice in the way that is taught by your testimonies
    as much as I delight in all riches.
119.15:
I will meditate on your precepts,
and I will consider your paths.
119.16:
In your statutes I delight.
I will not forget your words.
119.17:
Reward your servant.
Then I will live, and I will keep your words.
119.18: Uncover my eyes, and I will behold wonders from your law.
119.19:
I am an alien on earth.
Do not hide your commandments from me.
119.20: My soul is overwhelmed by desire for your judgments at all times.
119.21:
You rebuke the arrogant, who are cursed,
those who stray from your commandments.
119.22:
Remove scorn and contempt from me,
for I guard your testimonies.
119.23:
Though officials sit together and speak against me,
your servant will meditate on your statutes.
119.24:
Yes, your testimonies are my delights.
They are my advisors.
119.25:
My soul is stuck in the dust.
Revive my life according to your words.
119.26:
I told you about my ways and you answered me.
Teach me your statutes.
119.27:
Make me understand the meaning of your precepts.
Then I will meditate on your wonders.
119.28:
My soul melts with sorrow.
By your words make me stand firm.
119.29:
Turn me away from false ways,
and be gracious to me through your law.
119.30:
I have chosen the way of truth.
I accept your judgments.
119.31:
I cling to your testimonies, O Lord.
Do not let me be put to shame.
119.32:
I run the way of your commandments,
for you have strengthened my heart.
119.33:
Teach me, O Lord, the way of your statutes.
Then I will guard it to the end.
119.34:
Give me understanding, and I will guard your law.
I will keep it with all my heart.
119.35:
Make me walk on the path of your commandments,
for I take pleasure in it.
119.36:
Direct my heart toward your testimonies
and not toward material gain.
119.37:
Keep my eyes from looking at worthless things.
Give me life according to your ways.
119.38:
Confirm your sayings to your servant,
so that you may be feared.
119.39:
Take away my disgrace which I dread,
for your judgments are good.
119.40:
How I long for your precepts!
Give me life in your righteousness.
119.41:
So let your mercies come to me, O Lord,
and let your salvation come according to your sayings.
119.42:
Then I will give an answer to those who insult me,
    because I trust in your words.
119.43:
But do not tear away the word of truth from my mouth,
    because I wait confidently for your judgments.
119.44: Then I will continually keep your law forever and ever.
119.45:
Then I will walk around freely,
because I have sought your precepts.
119.46:
Then I will speak of your testimonies before kings,
and I will not be put to shame.
119.47: For I delight in your commandments, which I love.
119.48:
I lift up my hands to your commandments, which I love,
and I meditate on your statutes.
119.49:
Remember your word to your servant,
because you have given me hope.
119.50:
This is my comfort in my suffering:
that your saying gives me life.
119.51:
The arrogant mock me constantly,
but I do not fall away from your law.
119.52:
I remember your judgments from of old, Lord,
and I comfort myself with them.
119.53: Indignation grips me because of the wicked, who forsake your laws.
119.54: Your statutes are songs for me in the house where I am staying.
119.55:
I remember your name during the night, O Lord,
and I will keep your laws.
119.56: This I have done: I guard your precepts.
119.57:
You are my portion, O Lord.
I said I would keep your words.
119.58:
I have sought your favor with all my heart.
Be gracious to me according to your sayings.
119.59:
I have considered my ways,
and I have turned my feet to your testimonies.
119.60:
I will hurry. I will not delay.
I will keep your commandments.
119.61:
The ropes of the wicked bind me,
but I do not forget your law.
119.62: At midnight I rise to give you thanks for your righteous judgments.
119.63:
I am a companion to all who fear you,
that is, to all who keep your precepts.
119.64:
Your mercy, Lord, fills the earth.
Teach me your statutes.
119.65:
You have done good for your servant, O Lord,
    according to your words.
119.66:
Teach me good judgment and knowledge,
for I believe in your commandments.
119.67:
Before I was afflicted I strayed,
but now I keep your saying.
119.68:
You are good, and you do good.
Teach me your statutes.
119.69:
The arrogant have smeared me with lies.
I guard your precepts with all my heart.
119.70:
Their calloused hearts feel nothing,
but I delight in your law.
119.71:
It was good for me that I was afflicted,
so that I might learn your statutes.
119.72:
Better for me is the law from your mouth
    than thousands of pieces of silver and gold.
119.73:
Your hands made me and established me.
Give me understanding.
Then I will learn your commandments.
119.74:
May those who fear you see me and rejoice,
because I wait confidently for your word.
119.75:
I know, Lord, that your judgments are righteous.
In faithfulness you have afflicted me.
119.76:
Please let your mercy be my comfort,
    according to your saying to your servant.
119.77:
Let your abundant compassion come to me that I may live,
because your law is my delight.
119.78:
Let the arrogant be put to shame,
because they have wronged me with lies.
As for me, I will meditate on your precepts.
119.79:
Let those who fear you turn to me,
and those who know your testimonies.
119.80:
Let my heart be blameless regarding your statutes,
so that I may not be put to shame.
119.81:
My soul is worn out, as I wait for your salvation.
I wait confidently for your word.
119.82:
My eyes are worn out, as I look for your sayings.
I say, “When will you comfort me?”
119.83:
Though I am like a wineskin in the smoke,
I do not forget your statutes.
119.84:
How many days does your servant have?
When will you inflict judgment on my persecutors?
119.85:
The arrogant dig pits for me.
This is against your laws.
119.86:
All your commandments are trustworthy.
The arrogant persecute me wrongfully. Help me.
119.87:
They almost put an end to me here on earth,
but I have not forsaken your precepts.
119.88:
Give me life according to your mercy,
and I will obey the testimony from your mouth.
119.89: To eternity, O Lord, your word is fixed firmly in the heavens.
119.90:
For generation after generation, your faithfulness remains.
You established the earth, and it stands.
119.91:
As for your judgments, they stand to this day,
because all things are your servants.
119.92:
Unless your law had been my delight,
I would have perished in my affliction.
119.93:
To eternity I will not forget your precepts,
because by them you have given me life.
119.94:
I am yours. Save me,
because I have sought your precepts.
119.95:
The wicked are lying in wait for me to kill me,
but I will ponder your testimonies.
119.96:
I see a limit to all perfection,
but your commandment has no limits.
119.97:
How I love your laws!
I meditate on them all day long.
119.98:
Your commandment makes me wiser than my enemies,
because it is always with me.
119.99:
I have more wisdom than all my teachers,
because your testimonies are my meditation.
119.100:
I have more understanding than the elders,
    because I guard your precepts.
119.101:
I have kept my feet off every evil path
    in order to keep your words.
119.102:
I have not turned from your judgments,
    because you yourself have instructed me.
119.103:
How sweet are your sayings to my taste,
    sweeter than honey to my mouth!
119.104:
From your precepts I gain understanding.
    Therefore, I hate every false road.
119.105:
Your words are a lamp for my feet
    and a light for my path.
119.106:
I have sworn and affirmed
    that I will keep your righteous judgments.
119.107:
I have suffered much.
    Lord, give me life according to your words.
119.108:
Lord, please accept the willing praise from my mouth,
    and teach me your judgments.
119.109:
I take my life in my hands constantly,
    but I will not forget your law.
119.110:
The wicked have set a snare for me,
    but I have not wandered from your precepts.
119.111:
I have inherited your testimonies forever.
    Yes, they are the joy of my heart.
119.112:
I turn my heart to do your statutes,
    forever, right to the end.
119.113: I hate the doubleminded, but I love your law.
119.114:
You are my hiding place and my shield.
    I wait confidently for your word.
119.115:
Get away from me, you evildoers,
    so that I may guard the commandments of my God!
119.116:
Sustain me according to your sayings, and I will live.
    Do not let me be ashamed of my hope.
119.117:
Hold me up, and I will be saved.
    Then I will always have regard for your statutes.
119.118:
You reject all who stray from your statutes,
    because their deceitfulness is built on a lie.
119.119:
You discard all the wicked of the earth like slag.
    Therefore, I love your testimonies.
119.120:
My flesh trembles because I am afraid of you,
    because I fear your judgments.
119.121:
I have carried out what is just and right.
    Do not leave me to my oppressors.
119.122:
Guarantee good for your servant.
    Do not let the arrogant oppress me.
119.123:
My eyes wear out,
    as I watch for your salvation and your righteousness.
119.124:
Deal with your servant according to your mercy,
    and teach me your statutes.
119.125:
I am your servant. Give me discernment,
    so that I may know your testimonies.
119.126:
Lord, it is time to do something!
    They have broken your laws.
119.127:
Because I love your commandments more than gold,
    more than pure gold,
119.128:
because I value everything in all your precepts,
    I hate every wrong road.
119.129:
Your testimonies are wonders.
    That is why my soul guards them.
119.130:
The doorway to your words lets in light.
    It gives understanding to the inexperienced.
119.131:
I open wide my mouth and I gasp,
    because I long for your commandments.
119.132:
Turn to me and give me grace.
    This is your judgment for those who love your name.
119.133:
Keep my footsteps steady by your sayings,
    and do not let any evil rule over me.
119.134:
Redeem me from oppressive people,
    and I will keep your precepts.
119.135:
Make your face shine on your servant,
    and teach me your statutes.
119.136:
Streams of water run down from my eyes,
    because they do not keep your laws.
119.137:
You are righteous, O Lord,
    and your judgments are right.
119.138:
You have commanded your testimonies.
    They are righteous and very trustworthy.
119.139:
My zeal wears me out,
    because my foes forget your words.
119.140:
Your saying has been thoroughly refined,
    and your servant loves it.
119.141:
I am insignificant and despised,
    but I do not forget your precepts.
119.142:
Your righteousness is righteous forever,
    and your law is truth.
119.143:
Distress and anguish have found me,
    but your commandments are my delights.
119.144:
Your testimonies are right forever.
    Give me understanding, and I will live.
119.145:
I call with all my heart.
    Answer me, O Lord.
    I will guard your statutes.
119.146:
I call to you. Save me,
    and I will keep your testimonies.
119.147:
I get up before dawn, and I cry for help.
    I wait confidently for your word.
119.148:
My eyes look forward to the night watches
    when I can meditate on your sayings.
119.149:
Hear my voice according to your mercy.
    Lord, give me life based on your judgments.
119.150:
Those who pursue evil plans are near,
    but they are far from your law.
119.151:
You are near, O Lord,
    and all your commandments are truth.
119.152:
Long ago I knew from your testimonies
    that you established them to endure forever.
119.153:
See my affliction and deliver me,
    because I have not forgotten your law.
119.154:
Argue my case and redeem me.
    Give me life according to your saying.
119.155:
Salvation is far away from the wicked,
    because they do not pursue your statutes.
119.156:
Your compassions are many, O Lord.
    Give me life according to your judgments.
119.157:
Many are my persecutors and my foes,
    but I have not turned from your testimonies.
119.158:
I look at the hypocrites and I loathe them,
    because they do not keep your saying.
119.159:
See how I love your precepts.
    Lord, according to your mercy, give me life.
119.160:
The sum of your word is truth.
    All your righteous judgment is eternal.
119.161:
Officials persecute me without cause,
    but my heart trembles at your word.
119.162:
I rejoice over your sayings,
    like one who finds much plunder.
119.163:
I hate and detest falsehood,
    but I love your law.
119.164: Seven times a day I praise you for your righteous judgments.
119.165:
Great peace belongs to those who love your law,
    and nothing is a stumbling block for them.
119.166:
I wait for your salvation, O Lord,
    and I obey your commandments.
119.167:
My soul keeps your testimonies.
    I love them greatly.
119.168:
I keep your precepts and your testimonies,
    because all my ways are before you.
119.169:
May my loud cry come before you, Lord.
    Give me understanding through your word.
119.170:
May my plea for mercy come before you.
    Deliver me according to your saying.
119.171:
May my lips overflow with praise,
    because you teach me your statutes.
119.172:
May my tongue sing of your saying,
    because all your commandments are righteousness.
119.173:
May your hand be ready to help me,
    because I have chosen your precepts.
119.174:
I long for your salvation, O Lord,
    and your law is my delight.
119.175:
Let my soul live and praise you,
    and may your judgments help me.
119.176:
I have strayed like a perishing sheep.
    Seek your servant,
    because I have not forgotten your commandments.

120.2:
In my distress I called to the Lord,
and he answered me.
120.3:
Lord, save my life from lying lips.
Save me from deceitful tongues.
120.4:
What will he give to you?
What more will he add to you, you deceitful tongue?
120.5: A warrior’s sharpened arrows with hot coals of the broom tree.
120.6:
Woe to me that I am an alien in Meshek,
that I dwell among the tents of Kedar!
120.7: For too long my soul has dwelt with those who hate peace.
120.8: I am for peace, but when I speak, they are for war.

121.1:
I lift up my eyes to the mountains.
Where does my help come from?
121.2:
My help comes from the Lord,
    the Maker of heaven and earth.
121.3:
He will not let your foot stumble.
He who watches over you will not slumber.
121.4:
Yes, he who watches over Israel will not slumber.
He will not sleep.
121.5:
The Lord watches over you.
The Lord is your shade at your right hand.
121.6:
The sun will not strike you by day,
nor the moon by night.
121.7:
The Lord will watch to keep you from all harm.
He will watch over your life.
121.8:
The Lord will watch over your going and your coming
    from now to eternity.

122.1:
I rejoiced with those who said to me,
“Let us go to the house of the Lord.”
122.2: Our feet are standing in your gates, O Jerusalem.
122.3: Jerusalem is a well-built city that is firmly joined together,
122.4:
a city to which the tribes go up, the tribes of the Lord,
    as a testimony to Israel,
    to give praise to the name of the Lord.
122.5:
That is where the thrones for judgment sit,
the thrones of the house of David.
122.6:
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
“May those who love you prosper.
122.7:
May there be peace within your fortifications,
prosperity within your citadels.”
122.8:
For the sake of my brothers and my friends,
now I will say, “Peace be within you.”
122.9:
For the sake of the house of the Lord our God,
I will seek good for you.

123.1:
To you I lift up my eyes,
to you who are seated in heaven.
123.2:
Indeed, as the eyes of slaves look to the hand of their master,
as the eyes of a maid look to the hand of her mistress,
so our eyes look to the Lord our God, until he shows us his grace.
123.3:
Show grace to us, O Lord.
Show grace to us,
for we have had our fill of contempt.
123.4:
Our souls have had their fill of the scorn of the smug
and of the contempt of the arrogant.

124.1:
Unless it was the Lord who was for us—
let Israel say—
124.2:
unless it was the Lord who was for us
when people rose against us,
124.3:
they would have swallowed us alive
when their anger burned against us.
124.4:
Then the waters would have submerged us.
The torrent would have swept our lives away.
124.5: Then the wild waters would have swept us away.
124.6:
Blessed be the Lord,
    who has not let us be prey for their teeth.
124.7:
We have escaped with our lives
    like a bird out of the fowlers’ snare.
The snare has been broken, and we have escaped.
124.8:
Our help is in the name of the Lord,
    the Maker of heaven and earth.

125.1:
Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion.
It cannot be shaken. It will stand forever.
125.2:
As Jerusalem is surrounded by mountains,
so the Lord surrounds his people from now to eternity.
125.3:
No, the scepter of wickedness will not rest
    on the land assigned to the righteous,
so that the righteous do not reach out their hands toward evil.
125.4:
Do good, O Lord, for the good
and for those who are upright in their hearts.
125.5:
But those who turn to their crooked ways—
the Lord will send them away with the evildoers.
Peace be on Israel.

126.1:
When the Lord restored the captives to Zion,
    we were like dreamers.
126.2:
Then our mouths were filled with laughter,
and our tongues with shouts of joy.
Then they said among the nations,
“The Lord has done great things for them.”
126.3:
The Lord has done great things for us.
We are glad.
126.4: Restore our fortunes, O Lord, like the dry gulches of the Negev.
126.5: Those who sow with weeping will reap with joyful shouts.
126.6:
The one who walks along weeping, carrying a bag of seed to sow,
    will come back again with joyful shouts, carrying his sheaves.

127.1:
If the Lord does not build the house,
    it is useless for the builders to work hard over it.
If the Lord does not watch over the city,
    it is useless for the watchman to stand guard.
127.2:
It is useless for you to get up early and to work late,
worrying about bread to eat,
because God grants sleep to the one he loves.
127.3:
Indeed, children are a heritage from the Lord.
The fruit of the womb is a reward from him.
127.4:
Sons born during one’s youth are like arrows
    in the hand of a warrior.
127.5:
How blessed is the man whose quiver is full of them.
They will not be put to shame
    when they dispute with enemies at the city gate.

128.1:
How blessed is everyone who fears the Lord,
everyone who is walking in his ways.
128.2:
Yes, you will eat the food you worked for.
How blessed you are! It will go well for you!
128.3:
Your wife will be like a fruitful vine in the inner rooms of your house.
Your children will be like olive shoots around your table.
128.4: Look! This is how blessed the man is who fears the Lord!
128.5:
May the Lord bless you from Zion,
so that you see the prosperity of Jerusalem,
all the days of your life,
128.6:
and you see your children’s children.
Peace be on Israel.

129.1:
Greatly they have afflicted me from my youth—
let Israel say—
129.2:
greatly they have afflicted me from my youth,
yet they have not been able to defeat me.
129.3:
On my back plowmen have plowed.
They made their furrows long.
129.4:
The Lord is righteous.
He has cut the ropes of the wicked to pieces.
129.5: Let all who hate Zion be ashamed and turned back.
129.6:
Let them be like grass on the roof,
    which withers even before it is pulled up.
129.7:
The reaper cannot fill his hand with it.
The one who binds sheaves cannot fill his arms.
129.8:
May those who pass by never say,
“The blessing of the Lord be with you.
We bless you in the name of the Lord.”

130.1: Out of the depths I have called to you, O Lord.
130.2:
Lord, hear my voice.
Let your ears be attentive to the sound of my cry for mercy.
130.3:
If you, Lord, kept a record of guilt,
O Lord, who could stand?
130.4:
But with you there is pardon,
so you are feared.
130.5:
I wait for the Lord. My soul waits,
and in his word I have put my hope.
130.6:
My soul waits for the Lord
more than watchmen wait for the morning,
more than watchmen wait for the morning.
130.7:
Israel, wait confidently for the Lord,
because with the Lord there is mercy.
With him there is abundant redemption.
130.8: So he himself will redeem Israel from all its guilt.

131.1:
Lord, my heart is not haughty,
and my eyes are not proud.
So I do not intrude into great matters
or into things too wonderful for me.
131.2:
Instead I have soothed and quieted my soul.
As a nursed child rests with its mother,
like a nursed child my soul rests with me.
131.3:
Wait confidently, O Israel, for the Lord
    from now to eternity.

132.1: Remember for David’s sake, O Lord, all his afflictions.
132.2:
Remember how he swore to the Lord.
He made a vow to the Mighty One of Jacob:
132.3:
“I will not enter my own house.
I will not get into my own bed.
132.4:
I will not allow my eyes to sleep
or my eyelids to slumber,
132.5:
until I find a place for the Lord,
a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
132.6:
Yes, we heard about it in Ephrathah.
We found it in the fields of Ja’ar.
132.7:
Let us go to his dwelling place.
Let us bow down at his footstool.
132.8:
Arise, O Lord, come to your resting place,
    you and the ark of your strength.
132.9:
May your priests be clothed with righteousness.
May your favored ones shout for joy.
132.10:
For the sake of David your servant,
do not reject the face of your Anointed One.
132.11:
The Lord swore to David
    a truth from which he will not turn back:
“From the fruit of your body
    I will place kings on your throne.
132.12:
If your sons keep my covenant
and my testimonies that I teach them,
then their sons will sit on your throne forever.”
132.13:
For the Lord has chosen Zion.
He has desired it for his dwelling.
132.14:
“This is my resting place forever.
Here I will live, for I have desired it.
132.15:
I will bless her greatly with food.
I will satisfy Zion’s poor with bread.
132.16:
I will clothe her priests with salvation,
and her favored ones will shout for joy.
132.17:
There I will make a horn shoot up for David.
I will set up a lamp for my Anointed One.
132.18:
I will clothe his enemies with shame,
but on him his crown will be beautiful.”

133.1:
Look, how good and how pleasant it is
    when brothers live together in unity!
133.2:
It is like the precious oil poured on the head,
    running down on the beard, the beard of Aaron,
    running down on the collar of his robes.
133.3:
It is like the dew from Hermon
    running down on the mountains of Zion.
For there the Lord commands this blessing: life to eternity.

134.1:
Come, bless the Lord, all you servants of the Lord,
    who stand in the house of the Lord at night.
134.2:
Lift up your hands toward the sanctuary
and bless the Lord.
134.3: May the Lord, the Maker of heaven and earth, bless you from Zion.

135.1:
Praise the Lord.
Praise the name of the Lord.
Praise him, you servants of the Lord,
135.2:
who stand in the house of the Lord,
    in the courtyards of the house of our God.
135.3:
Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good.
Make music to his name, for it is pleasant.
135.4:
Yes, the Lord chose Jacob for himself.
He chose Israel as his special treasure.
135.5:
Yes, I know that the Lord is great.
Our Lord is greater than all gods.
135.6:
The Lord does whatever he pleases
    in the heavens and on the earth,
    in the seas and in all the depths.
135.7:
He makes clouds rise from the end of the earth.
He sends lightning for the rainstorm.
He releases the wind from his storehouses.
135.8:
He is the one who struck down
    the firstborn of Egypt, both men and animals.
135.9:
Egypt! He sent warning signs into your midst,
    against Pharaoh and against all his officials.
135.10:
He is the one who struck down many nations.
He killed mighty kings—
135.11:
Sihon king of the Amorites,
    and Og king of Bashan,
    and all the kingdoms of Canaan.
135.12:
He gave their land as a possession,
a possession to Israel, his people.
135.13:
Lord, your name stands forever.
Lord, your reputation remains through all generations.
135.14:
For the Lord will judge in favor of his people.
He will have pity on his servants.
135.15: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of human hands.
135.16:
They have a mouth, but they cannot speak.
They have eyes, but they cannot see.
135.17:
They have ears, but cannot hear.
There is not even any breath in their mouths.
135.18:
Those who make them will be like them.
So will all who trust in them.
135.19:
House of Israel, bless the Lord.
House of Aaron, bless the Lord.
135.20:
House of Levi, bless the Lord.
You who fear the Lord, bless the Lord.
135.21:
The Lord, who dwells in Jerusalem, will be blessed from Zion.
Praise the Lord.

136.1:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good.
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.2:
Give thanks to the God of Gods.
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.3:
Give thanks to the Lord of Lords.
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.4:
To him who alone does great wonders—
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.5:
To him who by his understanding made the heavens—
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.6:
To him who spread out the earth on the waters—
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.7:
To him who made the great lights,
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.8:
the sun to rule by day,
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.9:
the moon and stars to rule by night—
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.10:
To him who struck Egypt by killing their firstborn,
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.11:
and brought Israel out from their midst,
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.12:
with a mighty hand and outstretched arm—
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.13:
To him who cut the Red Sea in two,
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.14:
and brought Israel through the middle of it,
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.15:
but brushed off Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea—
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.16:
To him who made his people travel through the wilderness—
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.17:
To him who struck down great kings,
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.18:
and killed mighty kings,
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.19:
Sihon king of the Amorites,
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.20:
and Og king of Bashan,
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.21:
and gave their land as a possession,
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.22:
a possession to his servant Israel.
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.23:
Who remembered us in our low condition,
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.24:
and tore us out of the hands of our oppressors.
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.25:
He gives food to all living creatures.
    For his mercy endures forever.
136.26:
Give thanks to the God of the heavens.
    For his mercy endures forever.

137.1:
Beside the rivers of Babylon,
there we sat, and, yes, we wept as we remembered Zion.
137.2: There we hung up our lyres on the willows,
137.3:
because there our captors asked us for words of a song,
and our tormentors asked for a happy song:
“Sing for us one of the songs of Zion!”
137.4: How can we sing a song of the Lord on foreign soil?
137.5:
If I forget you, Jerusalem,
may my right hand forget how to play music.
137.7:
Remember the day of Jerusalem, O Lord,
against the descendants of Edom who said,
“Tear it down, tear it down to its foundations!”
137.8:
Daughter of Babylon, doomed to be destroyed,
how blessed is the one who repays you
    with the same deeds you did against us.
137.9:
How blessed is the one who seizes your children
and dashes them against the cliff.

138.1:
I will thank you with all my heart.
Before the gods I will make music for you.
138.2:
I will bow down toward your holy temple.
I will give thanks to your name
    because of your mercy and because of your truth.
Yes, you made your word even greater than your name.
138.3:
By day I called, and you answered me.
You have made my soul strong.
138.4:
All the kings of the earth will thank you, Lord,
when they have heard the message from your mouth.
138.5:
Then they will sing about the ways of the Lord,
because the glory of the Lord is great.
138.6:
Indeed the Lord is exalted, but he sees the lowly,
and he recognizes the proud from a distance.
138.7:
If I walk surrounded by danger, you keep me alive
    in spite of the anger of my enemies.
You stretch out your hand.
You save me with your right hand.
138.8:
The Lord will fulfill his purpose for me.
Lord, your mercy endures forever.
Do not let go of the works of your hands.

139.1:
Lord, you have investigated me,
and you know.
139.2:
You know when I sit down and when I get up.
You understand my thoughts from far off.
139.3:
You keep track of when I travel and when I stay,
and you are familiar with all my ways.
139.4:
Before there is a word on my tongue,
    you, Lord, already know it completely.
139.5:
You put a fence behind me and in front of me,
and you have placed your hand on me.
139.6:
Such knowledge is too wonderful for me.
It is too high—I cannot grasp it.
139.7:
Where can I go from your Spirit?
Where can I flee from your Presence?
139.8:
If I go up to heaven, you are there.
If I make my bed in hell—there you are!
139.9:
I rise on the wings of dawn.
I settle on the far side of the sea.
139.10:
Even there your hand guides me,
and your right hand holds on to me.
139.11:
And if I say, “Surely the darkness will hide me
and the light will become night around me,”
139.12:
then even the darkness will not be too dark for you.
The night will be as light as the day.
Darkness and light are the same to you.
139.13:
For you created my inner organs.
You wove me together in my mother’s womb.
139.14:
I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made.
Your works are wonderful,
and my soul knows that very well.
139.15:
My bones were not hidden from you
when I was made in the secret place,
when I was woven together in the depths of the earth.
139.16:
Your eyes saw my unfinished body.
In your book all of them were written.
Days were determined, before any of them existed.
139.17:
Your thoughts to me are so precious, O God!
How great is the sum of them!
139.18:
If I would count them,
    they would outnumber the grains of sand.
I awake, and I am still with you.
139.19:
If only you would slay the wicked, O God,
so that bloody men would depart from me,
139.20:
men who speak against you maliciously.
Your adversaries misuse your name.
139.21:
Do I not hate those who hate you, O Lord,
and detest those who rise up against you?
139.22: I absolutely hate them. To me they are enemies.
139.23:
Investigate me, God, and know my heart.
Test me and know my troubled thoughts.
139.24:
See if there is any way in me that causes pain,
and lead me in the way everlasting.

140.1:
Keep me safe, Lord, from the evil man.
Protect me from the violent man,
140.2:
who plans evil in his heart.
Every day they gather for battle.
140.3:
They sharpen their tongues like a snake. Interlude
The poison of vipers is under their lips.
140.4:
Keep me safe, Lord, from the hands of the wicked.
Protect me from the violent man, who plans to trip my feet.
140.5:
The proud have hidden a snare for me, and ropes.
They have spread out a net along my route. Interlude
They have set traps for me.
140.6:
I say to the Lord, “You are my God.”
Hear, O Lord, the sound of my cry for mercy.
140.7:
O Lord, my Lord, the strength of my salvation,
you cover my head on the day for weapons.
140.8:
Do not grant, O Lord, the desires of the wicked.
Do not let their scheme succeed when they rise up. Interlude
140.9:
May the trouble caused by their lips
    fall on the heads of those who surround me.
140.10:
Let burning coals fall on them.
Cause them to fall into the fire,
or into pits from which they will never rise.
140.11:
Do not let the slanderer be established in the land.
As for the man of violence—
may evil hunt him and beat him down.
140.12:
I know that the Lord will provide justice for the oppressed,
    judgment for the poor.
140.13:
Surely the righteous will give thanks to your name.
The upright will live in your presence.

141.1:
Lord, I call to you. Hurry to me.
Turn your ear toward my voice when I call to you.
141.2:
May my prayer linger before you like incense,
the lifting up of my hands like an evening offering.
141.3:
Set a guard over my mouth, Lord.
Keep watch over the door of my lips.
141.4:
Do not let my heart turn toward anything evil,
to take part in wicked deeds with men who do evil.
Let me not taste their delicacies.
141.5:
Let a righteous man strike me—it is mercy.
Let him rebuke me—it is lotion on my head.
My head will not refuse it.
But my prayer is still against their evil deeds.
141.6:
Their rulers will be thrown down by the sides of the cliff,
and they will hear that my words were pleasant.
141.7:
They will say, “As one splits and breaks up the earth,
so our bones have been scattered at the mouth of the grave.”
141.8:
But my eyes look to you, Lord God.
In you I take refuge. Do not take away my life.
141.9:
Keep me from the snares they have set for me,
    from the traps of the evildoers.
141.10: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, while I pass by safely.

142.1: A maskil by David. When he was in the cave. A prayer.
142.2:
With my voice I cry out to the Lord.
With my voice I call to the Lord for mercy.
142.3:
I pour out my complaint before him.
I tell my distress before him.
142.4:
When my spirit grows faint within me,
you are the one who knows my course.
On the path where I walk they have hidden a snare for me.
142.5:
Look to my right and see.
There is no one who recognizes me.
There is no escape for me.
No one cares about my life.
142.6:
I cry out to you, Lord.
I say, “You are my refuge,
my portion in the land of the living.”
142.7:
Pay attention to my loud cry,
because I am very weak.
Rescue me from those who pursue me,
because they are too strong for me.
142.8:
Set me free from my prison,
so I can give thanks to your name.
Then the righteous will gather around me,
because you have accomplished your purpose for me.

143.1:
Lord, hear my prayer.
Give ear to my cry for mercy.
In your faithfulness, answer me in your righteousness.
143.2:
Do not bring charges against your servant,
because no one living can be righteous before you.
143.3:
For the enemy pursues my soul.
He crushes my life to the ground.
He makes me dwell in dark places like those long dead,
143.4:
so my spirit grows faint inside me.
Within me my heart is devastated.
143.5:
I remember the days of long ago.
I meditate on all your works,
and I consider what your hands have done.
143.6:
I spread out my hands to you. Interlude
My soul thirsts for you like a weary land.
143.7:
Hurry! Answer me, Lord.
My spirit fails.
Do not hide your face from me,
or I will be like those who go down to the pit.
143.8:
Let me hear about your mercy in the morning,
    for I trust in you.
Teach me the way that I should go,
    for I lift up my soul to you.
143.9:
Rescue me from my enemies, O Lord,
    for I hide myself in you.
143.10:
Teach me to do your will,
    for you are my God.
May your good Spirit lead me on level ground.
143.11:
For the sake of your name, O Lord, preserve my life.
In your righteousness, bring me out of trouble.
143.12:
In your mercy, wipe out my enemies,
and destroy all who threaten my life,
for I am your servant.

144.1:
Blessed be the Lord my Rock,
who trains my hands for battle,
my fingers for war.
144.2:
He shows me mercy.
He is my stronghold, my high fortress.
He is my deliverer and my shield,
so I take refuge in him.
He subdues peoples under me.
144.3:
Lord, what is man that you notice him,
the son of man that you consider him?
144.4:
Man is like a breath.
His days are like a passing shadow.
144.5:
Lord, rip open your heavens and come down.
Touch the mountains so that they smoke.
144.6:
Send out lightning and scatter them.
Shoot your arrows and rout them.
144.7:
Reach down your hand from on high.
Rescue me and snatch me from the mighty waters,
from the hand of foreigners
144.8:
whose mouths speak lies,
who raise their right hands to a false oath.
144.9:
God, I will sing a new song to you.
On the ten-stringed harp I will make music to you,
144.10:
to you who gives victory to kings,
    to you who delivers David his servant from the evil sword.
144.11:
Rescue me and snatch me from the hand of foreigners
    whose mouths speak lies,
    who raise their right hands to a false oath.
144.12:
Then our sons in their youth will be like full-grown plants.
Our daughters will be like corner pillars carved to decorate a palace.
144.13:
Our storehouses will be filled with produce of every kind.
Our flocks will increase by thousands,
by tens of thousands in our countryside.
144.14:
Our oxen will pull heavy loads.
There will be no breaking through our walls,
no exile into captivity,
no cry of distress in our city squares.
144.15:
How blessed are the people for whom this is so.
How blessed are the people whose God is the Lord.

145.1:
I will exalt you, my God, the King,
and I will bless your name forever and ever.
145.2:
Every day I will bless you,
and I will praise your name forever and ever.
145.3:
Great is the Lord and worthy of great praise,
and there are no limits to the extent of his greatness.
145.4:
One generation will praise your deeds to another,
and they will declare your mighty acts.
145.5:
I will contemplate the glorious splendor of your majesty
and the accounts of your wonderful works.
145.6:
Then they will speak about the power of your awesome works,
and I will tell about your great deeds.
145.7:
They will pour forth the memory of your abundant goodness
and sing loudly about your righteousness.
145.8:
The Lord is gracious and compassionate,
slow to anger and great in mercy.
145.9:
The Lord is good to all.
His compassion extends over all he has made.
145.10:
Everyone you have made will thank you, O Lord,
and the ones you favor will bless you.
145.11:
They will tell about the glory of your kingdom,
and they will speak about your might,
145.12:
to make known his might to the children of Adam,
to make known the glorious splendor of his kingdom.
145.13:
Your kingdom is a kingdom for all ages,
and your dominion endures through all generations.
The Lord is faithful to all his words
and merciful toward all he has made.
145.14:
The Lord lifts up all who fall,
and he supports all who are bowed down.
145.15:
The eyes of all look eagerly to you,
and you give them their food at the proper time.
145.16:
He opens his hand,
and he satisfies the desire of every living thing.
145.17:
The Lord is righteous in all his ways
and merciful toward all that he has made.
145.18:
The Lord is near to all who call on him,
to all who call on him in truth.
145.19:
He grants the desire of those who fear him.
He hears their cry and saves them.
145.20:
The Lord watches over all who love him,
but he will destroy all the wicked.
145.21:
My mouth will speak the praise of the Lord.
Let all flesh bless his holy name forever and ever.

146.1:
Praise the Lord.
Praise the Lord, O my soul.
146.2:
I will praise the Lord as long as I live.
I will make music to my God as long as I exist.
146.3:
Do not trust in human helpers,
in a mortal man who cannot save you.
146.4:
His spirit departs.
He returns to the ground he came from.
On that day, his plans have perished.
146.5:
Blessed is everyone who has the God of Jacob as his help.
His hope is in the Lord his God,
146.6:
the Maker of heaven and earth,
    the sea, and everything which is in them.
He is the one who stays faithful forever.
146.7:
He obtains justice for the oppressed.
He gives food to the hungry.
The Lord releases prisoners.
146.8:
The Lord opens the eyes of the blind.
The Lord lifts up those who are bowed down.
The Lord loves the righteous.
146.9:
The Lord watches over the aliens.
The fatherless and the widow he sustains,
but he turns aside the way of the wicked.
146.10:
The Lord reigns forever.
Your God, O Zion, rules for all generations.
Praise the Lord.

147.1:
Praise the Lord.
How good it is to make music to our God.
Yes, praise is pleasant and fitting!
147.2:
The one who builds Jerusalem is the Lord.
He assembles the outcasts of Israel.
147.3:
He is the one who heals the brokenhearted
and who bandages their wounds.
147.4:
He counts the number of the stars.
He calls them all by name.
147.5:
Great is our Lord and mighty in power.
To his understanding there is no limit.
147.6:
The one who sustains the humble is the Lord.
He pushes the wicked down to the ground.
147.7:
Respond to the Lord with thanksgiving.
Make music to our God on the lyre.
147.8:
He is the one who covers the sky with clouds.
He determines rain for the earth.
He makes grass sprout on the mountains.
147.9:
He gives their food to the cattle
and to the young ravens when they call.
147.10:
He is not impressed by the strength of the horse.
He is not pleased with the legs of a man.
147.11:
The Lord is pleased with those who fear him,
those who wait for his mercy.
147.12:
Worship the Lord, O Jerusalem.
Praise your God, O Zion,
147.13:
because he strengthens the bars on your gates.
He blesses your children within you.
147.14:
He brings peace to your borders.
He satisfies you with the best wheat.
147.15:
He sends his message to the earth.
His word runs swiftly.
147.16:
He gives snow like wool.
He scatters frost like ashes.
147.17:
He sends his hail like pieces of bread.
Who can stand in the face of his cold winds?
147.18:
He sends his word, and the ice melts.
He breathes on the snow. The waters flow.
147.19:
He reveals his words to Jacob,
his statutes and his judgments to Israel.
147.20:
He has not done this for any other nation.
They do not know his judgments.
Praise the Lord.

148.1:
Praise the Lord.
Praise the Lord from the heavens.
Praise him in the heights.
148.2:
Praise him, all his angels.
Praise him, all his armies.
148.3:
Praise him, sun and moon.
Praise him, all you bright stars.
148.4:
Praise him, you highest heavens
and you waters which are above the heavens.
148.5:
Let them praise the name of the Lord,
because he commanded, and they were created.
148.6:
He caused them to stand forever and ever.
He gave a decree, and it will not pass away.
148.7:
Praise the Lord from the earth,
great sea creatures and all the depths,
148.8:
fire and hail, snow and fog,
storm winds that obey his word,
148.9:
mountains and all hills,
fruit trees and all cedars,
148.10:
wild animals and all cattle,
crawling creatures and flying birds,
148.11:
kings of the earth and all peoples,
officials and all judges on earth,
148.12:
young men and also young women,
old people with young people.
148.13:
Let them praise the name of the Lord,
for his name alone is exalted.
His splendor is above the earth and the heavens.
148.14:
He has raised up a horn for his people—
the praise of all his favored ones—
for the children of Israel, the people close to him.
Praise the Lord.

149.1:
Praise the Lord.
Sing to the Lord a new song.
Sing his praise in the congregation of his favored ones.
149.2:
Let Israel rejoice in its Maker.
Let the people of Zion celebrate for their King.
149.3:
Let them praise his name with dancing.
With hand drum and lyre let them make music to him.
149.4:
For the Lord is pleased with his people.
He adorns the humble with salvation.
149.5:
Let those he favors rejoice in honor.
Let them shout for joy on their beds.
149.6:
May high praise of God be in their throats,
and a two-edged sword in their hands,
149.7:
to inflict vengeance on the nations
and punishments on the peoples,
149.8:
to bind their kings with chains
and their nobles with iron shackles,
149.9:
to carry out the judgment written against them.
This is the glory of all his favored people.
Praise the Lord.

150.1:
Praise the Lord.
Praise God in his sanctuary.
Praise him in the expanse that shows his might.
150.2:
Praise him for his acts of power.
Praise him according to his abundant greatness.
150.3:
Praise him with a blast of the ram’s horn.
Praise him with the harp and the lyre.
150.4:
Praise him with hand drums and dancing.
Praise him with the strings and the flute.
150.5:
Praise him with the sounding cymbals.
Praise him with loud cymbals.
150.6:
Let everything that has breath praise the Lord.
Praise the Lord.
